{html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--prefix PREFIX] --network <network> [--device <device-id>] [--device-owner <device-owner>] [--vnic-type <vnic-type>] [--host <host-id>] [--fixed-ip subnet=<subnet>,ip-address=<ip-address>] [--binding-profile <binding-profile>] [--enable | --disable] [--mac-address <mac-address>] [--project <project>] [--project-domain <project-domain>] <name> Create a new port **Positional arguments:** ``<name>`` Name of this port **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``--network <network>`` Network this port belongs to (name or ID) ``--device <device-id>`` Port device ID ``--device-owner <device-owner>`` Device owner of this port ``--vnic-type <vnic-type>`` VNIC type for this port (direct | direct-physical | macvtap | normal | baremetal, default: normal) ``--host <host-id>`` Allocate port on host <host-id> (ID only) ``--fixed-ip`` subnet=<subnet>,ip-address=<ip-address> Desired IP and/or subnet (name or ID) for this port: subnet=<subnet>,ip-address=<ip-address> (repeat option to set multiple fixed IP addresses) ``--binding-profile <binding-profile>`` Custom data to be passed as binding:profile: <key>=<value> (repeat option to set multiple binding:profile data) ``--enable`` Enable port (default) ``--disable`` Disable port ``--mac-address <mac-address>`` MAC address of this port ``--project <project>`` Owner's project (name or ID) ``--project-domain <project-domain>`` Domain the project belongs to (name or ID). This can be used in case collisions between project names exist. .. _openstack_port_delete: usage: openstack port delete [-h] <port> [<port> ...].. _openstack_port_list: openstack port list ------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: openstack port list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--router <router>] List ports **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``--router <router>`` List only ports attached to this router (name or ID) .. _openstack_port_set: openstack port set ------------------ .. code-block:: console usage: openstack port set [-h] [--device <device-id>] [--device-owner <device-owner>] [--vnic-type <vnic-type>] [--host <host-id>] [--enable | --disable] [--name <name>] [--fixed-ip subnet=<subnet>,ip-address=<ip-address> | --no-fixed-ip] [--binding-profile <binding-profile> | --no-binding-profile] <port> Set port properties **Positional arguments:** ``<port>`` Port to modify (name or ID) **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``--device <device-id>`` Port device ID ``--device-owner <device-owner>`` Device owner of this port ``--vnic-type <vnic-type>`` VNIC type for this port (direct | direct-physical | macvtap | normal | baremetal, default: normal) ``--host <host-id>`` Allocate port on host <host-id> (ID only) ``--enable`` Enable port ``--disable`` Disable port ``--name <name>`` Set port name ``--fixed-ip`` subnet=<subnet>,ip-address=<ip-address> Desired IP and/or subnet (name or ID) for this port: subnet=<subnet>,ip-address=<ip-address> (repeat option to set multiple fixed IP addresses) ``--no-fixed-ip`` Clear existing information of fixed IP addresses ``--binding-profile <binding-profile>`` Custom data to be passed as binding:profile: <key>=<value> (repeat option to set multiple binding:profile data) ``--no-binding-profile`` Clear existing information of binding:profile .. _openstack_port_show: usage: openstack port show [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}].. _openstack_project_create: usage: openstack project create _openstack_subnet_create: openstack subnet create ----------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: openstack subnet create [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--prefix PREFIX] [--project <project>] [--project-domain <project-domain>] [--subnet-pool <subnet-pool> | --use-default-subnet-pool] [--prefix-length <prefix-length>] [--subnet-range <subnet-range>] [--dhcp | --no-dhcp] [--gateway <gateway>] [--ip-version {4,6}] [--ipv6-ra-mode {dhcpv6-stateful,dhcpv6-stateless,slaac}] [--ipv6-address-mode {dhcpv6-stateful,dhcpv6-stateless,slaac}] --network <network> [--allocation-pool start=<ip-address>,end=<ip-address>] [--dns-nameserver <dns-nameserver>] [--host-route destination=<subnet>,gateway=<ip-address>] name Create a subnet **Positional arguments:** ``name`` New subnet name **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``--project <project>`` Owner's project (name or ID) ``--project-domain <project-domain>`` Domain the project belongs to (name or ID). This can be used in case collisions between project names exist. ``--subnet-pool <subnet-pool>`` Subnet pool from which this subnet will obtain a CIDR (Name or ID) ``--use-default-subnet-pool`` Use default subnet pool for :option:`--ip-version` ``--prefix-length <prefix-length>`` Prefix length for subnet allocation from subnet pool ``--subnet-range <subnet-range>`` Subnet range in CIDR notation (required if :option:`--subnet-` pool is not specified, optional otherwise) ``--dhcp`` Enable DHCP (default) ``--no-dhcp`` Disable DHCP ``--gateway <gateway>`` Specify a gateway for the subnet. The three options are: <ip-address>: Specific IP address to use as the gateway, 'auto': Gateway address should automatically be chosen from within the subnet itself, 'none': This subnet will not use a gateway, e.g.: :option:`--gateway` 192.168.9.1, :option:`--gateway` auto, :option:`--gateway` none (default is 'auto') ``--ip-version {4,6} IP`` version (default is 4). Note that when subnet pool is specified, IP version is determined from the subnet pool and this option is ignored ``--ipv6-ra-mode {dhcpv6-stateful,dhcpv6-stateless,slaac}`` IPv6 RA (Router Advertisement) mode, valid modes: [dhcpv6-stateful, dhcpv6-stateless, slaac] ``--ipv6-address-mode {dhcpv6-stateful,dhcpv6-stateless,slaac}`` IPv6 address mode, valid modes: [dhcpv6-stateful, dhcpv6-stateless, slaac] ``--network <network>`` Network this subnet belongs to (name or ID) ``--allocation-pool`` start=<ip-address>,end=<ip-address> Allocation pool IP addresses for this subnet e.g.: start=192.168.199.2,end=192.168.199.254 (repeat option to add multiple IP addresses) ``--dns-nameserver <dns-nameserver>`` DNS server for this subnet (repeat option to set multiple DNS servers) ``--host-route`` destination=<subnet>,gateway=<ip-address> Additional route for this subnet e.g.: destination=10.10.0.0/16,gateway=192.168.71.254 destination: destination subnet (in CIDR notation) gateway: nexthop IP address (repeat option to add multiple routes) .. _openstack_subnet_delete: usage: openstack subnet delete [-h] <subnet>.. _openstack_subnet_list: usage: openstack subnet list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [--ip-version <ip-version>]``--ip-version <ip-version>`` List only subnets of given IP version in outputAllowed values for IP version are 4 and 6. .. _openstack_subnet_pool_create: openstack subnet pool create ---------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: openstack subnet pool create [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--prefix PREFIX] --pool-prefix <pool-prefix> [--default-prefix-length <default-prefix-length>] [--min-prefix-length <min-prefix-length>] [--max-prefix-length <max-prefix-length>] [--project <project>] [--project-domain <project-domain>] [--address-scope <address-scope>] [--default | --no-default] [--share | --no-share] <name> Create subnet pool **Positional arguments:** ``<name>`` Name of the new subnet pool **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``--pool-prefix <pool-prefix>`` Set subnet pool prefixes (in CIDR notation) (repeat option to set multiple prefixes) ``--default-prefix-length <default-prefix-length>`` Set subnet pool default prefix length ``--min-prefix-length <min-prefix-length>`` Set subnet pool minimum prefix length ``--max-prefix-length <max-prefix-length>`` Set subnet pool maximum prefix length ``--project <project>`` Owner's project (name or ID) ``--project-domain <project-domain>`` Domain the project belongs to (name or ID). This can be used in case collisions between project names exist. ``--address-scope <address-scope>`` Set address scope associated with the subnet pool (name or ID), prefixes must be unique across address scopes ``--default`` Set this as a default subnet pool ``--no-default`` Set this as a non-default subnet pool ``--share`` Set this subnet pool as shared ``--no-share`` Set this subnet pool as not shared .. _openstack_subnet_pool_delete: usage: openstack subnet pool delete [-h] <subnet-pool>.. _openstack_subnet_pool_list: usage: openstack subnet pool list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}].. _openstack_subnet_pool_set: openstack subnet pool set ------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: openstack subnet pool set [-h] [--name <name>] [--pool-prefix <pool-prefix>] [--default-prefix-length <default-prefix-length>] [--min-prefix-length <min-prefix-length>] [--max-prefix-length <max-prefix-length>] [--address-scope <address-scope> | --no-address-scope] [--default | --no-default] <subnet-pool> Set subnet pool properties **Positional arguments:** ``<subnet-pool>`` Subnet pool to modify (name or ID) **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``--name <name>`` Set subnet pool name ``--pool-prefix <pool-prefix>`` Set subnet pool prefixes (in CIDR notation) (repeat option to set multiple prefixes) ``--default-prefix-length <default-prefix-length>`` Set subnet pool default prefix length ``--min-prefix-length <min-prefix-length>`` Set subnet pool minimum prefix length ``--max-prefix-length <max-prefix-length>`` Set subnet pool maximum prefix length ``--address-scope <address-scope>`` Set address scope associated with the subnet pool (name or ID), prefixes must be unique across address scopes ``--no-address-scope`` Remove address scope associated with the subnet pool ``--default`` Set this as a default subnet pool ``--no-default`` Set this as a non-default subnet pool .. _openstack_subnet_pool_show: usage: openstack subnet pool show [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}].. _openstack_subnet_set: openstack subnet set -------------------- usage: openstack subnet set [-h] [--name <name>] [--dhcp | --no-dhcp] [--gateway <gateway>] [--allocation-pool start=<ip-address>,end=<ip-address>] [--dns-nameserver <dns-nameserver>] [--host-route destination=<subnet>,gateway=<ip-address>] <subnet> Set subnet properties Subnet to modify (name or ID)``--name <name>`` Updated name of the subnet ``--dhcp`` Enable DHCP ``--no-dhcp`` Disable DHCP ``--gateway <gateway>`` Specify a gateway for the subnet. The options are: <ip-address>: Specific IP address to use as the gateway, 'none': This subnet will not use a gateway, e.g.: :option:`--gateway` 192.168.9.1, :option:`--gateway` none ``--allocation-pool`` start=<ip-address>,end=<ip-address> Allocation pool IP addresses for this subnet e.g.: start=192.168.199.2,end=192.168.199.254 (repeat option to add multiple IP addresses) ``--dns-nameserver <dns-nameserver>`` DNS server for this subnet (repeat option to set multiple DNS servers) ``--host-route`` destination=<subnet>,gateway=<ip-address> Additional route for this subnet e.g.: destination=10.10.0.0/16,gateway=192.168.71.254 destination: destination subnet (in CIDR notation) gateway: nexthop IP address (repeat option to add multiple routes) .. _openstack_subnet_show: deleted_lines: This chapter documents :command:`openstack` version ``2.3.0``. $ openstack help COMMAND [--os-cacert <ca-bundle-file>] [--verify | --insecure] [--os-interface <interface>] [--timing] [--profile hmac-key] [--inspector-api-version INSPECTOR_API_VERSION] [--inspector-url INSPECTOR_URL] [--os-dns-api-version <dns-api-version>] [--os-orchestration-api-version <orchestration-api-version>] [--os-mb-api-version <mb-api-version>] [--os-key-manager-api-version <key-manager-api-version>] [--os-policy-api-version <policy-api-version>]``--profile`` hmac-key HMAC key to use for encrypting context data for performance profiling of operation. This key should be the value of one of the HMAC keys configured in osprofiler middleware in the projects user would like to profile. It needs to be specified in configuration files of the required projects.``--inspector-api-version INSPECTOR_API_VERSION`` inspector API version, only 1 is supported now (env: INSPECTOR_VERSION). ``--inspector-url INSPECTOR_URL`` inspector URL, defaults to localhost (env: INSPECTOR_URL).``--os-dns-api-version <dns-api-version>`` DNS API version, default=2 (Env: OS_DNS_API_VERSION) ``--os-orchestration-api-version <orchestration-api-version>`` Orchestration API version, default=1 (Env: OS_ORCHESTRATION_API_VERSION) ``--os-mb-api-version <mb-api-version>`` MB API version, default=1 (Env: OS_MB_API_VERSION) ``--os-key-manager-api-version <key-manager-api-version>`` Barbican API version, default=1 (Env: OS_KEY_MANAGER_API_VERSION)``--os-policy-api-version <policy-api-version>`` Policy API version, default=1 (Env: OS_POLICY_API_VERSION).. _openstack_access_token_create_with_identity_api_v3: usage: openstack --os-identity-api-version 3 access token usage: openstack --os-identity-api-version 3 zone transfer request show [-h] OpenStack with Identity API v2 commands (diff) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ This section documents only the difference in subcommands available for the openstack client when the Identity API version is changed from v3 to v2. .. _openstack_project_unset_with_identity_api_v2: openstack project unset (Identity API v2) ----------------------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: openstack --os-identity-api-version 2 project unset [-h] --property <key> <project> Unset project properties **Positional arguments:** ``<project>`` Project to modify (name or ID) **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``--property <key>`` Unset a project property (repeat option to unset multiple properties) .. _openstack_user_role_list_with_identity_api_v2: openstack user role list (Identity API v2) ------------------------------------------ .. code-block:: console usage: openstack --os-identity-api-version 2 user role list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--project <project>] [<user>] List user-role assignments **Positional arguments:** ``<user>`` User to list (name or ID) **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``--project <project>`` Filter users by <project> (name or ID)

commit_message:
[config-ref] cleanup Huawei Block Storage driver

backport: mitaka

Change-Id: Ic148ec6150c46279c2d98d38a4256cb135771454
(cherry picked from commit cab208e92a5762101beb7e559c9f3862224db6a8)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/35/328935/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: In this example, the version of Python is 2.7. If another version is used, make corresponding changes to the driver path. #. Copy `the Block Storage driver <http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/cinder/tree/cinder/volume/drivers/huawei?h=stable/mitaka>`_ to the Block Storage driver installation directory. command. If the ``State`` of ``cinder-volume`` is ``up``, that means ``cinder-volume`` is okay. # cinder service-list +-----------------+-----------------+------+---------+-------+----------------------------+-----------------+ | Binary | Host | Zone | Status | State | Updated_at | Disabled Reason | +-----------------+-----------------+------+---------+-------+----------------------------+-----------------+ | cinderscheduler | controller | nova | enabled | up | 2016-02-01T16:26:00.000000 | - | +-----------------+-----------------+------+---------+-------+----------------------------+-----------------+ | cindervolume | controller@v3r3 | nova | enabled | up | 2016-02-01T16:25:53.000000 | - | +-----------------+-----------------+------+---------+-------+----------------------------+-----------------+.. code-block:: ini#. Run the :command:`service cinder-volume restart` command to restart the#. Enable the multipathing switch of the Compute service module.#. Run the :command:`service nova-compute restart` command to restart theAdjust the driver configuration file as follows:The user name and password are separated by semicolons (``;``). Configuring multiple storage ---------------------------- Multiple storage systems configuration example: storage pools, separate them by semicolons (``;``).
deleted_lines: Ubuntu environment deployment ----------------------------- The OpenStack standard deployment steps are as follows: In this example, the version of Python is 2.7. If other version is used, make corresponding changes to the Driver path. #. Copy OpenStack Cinder Driver to the Cinder Driver installation directory. .. code-block:: console service cinder-volume restart command. If the "State" of ``cinder-volume`` is ``up``, that means cinder-volume is OK. root@ubuntuL004:/# cinder service-list +---------------+---------------+------+-------+-----+--------------------------+---------------+ |Binary |Host | Zone |Status |State|Updated_at |Disabled Reason| +---------------+---------------+------+-------+-----+--------------------------+---------------+ |cinderscheduler|ubuntuL004 | nova |enabled|up |2016-02-01T16:26:00.000000|- | +---------------+---------------+------+-------+-----+--------------------------+---------------+ |cindervolume |ubuntuL004@v3r3| nova |enabled|up |2016-02-01T16:25:53.000000|- | +---------------+---------------+------+-------+-----+--------------------------+---------------+ Red Hat OpenStack deployment ---------------------------- Red Hat OpenStack deployment steps are as follows: #. Before installation, delete all the installation files of Huawei OpenStack Driver. The default path may be: ``/usr/lib/python2.7/disk-packages/cinder/volume/drivers/huawei``. .. note:: In this example, the version of Python is 2.7. If other version is used, make corresponding changes to the Driver path. #. Copy OpenStack Cinder Driver to Cinder Driver installation directory. Refer to step 1 to find the default directory. #. Refer to chapter :ref:`huawei-driver-configuration` for the configurations. #. After configuration, restart the ``cinder-volume`` service: .. code-block:: console systemctl start openstack-cinder-volume.service #. Check the status of services using the :command:`cinder service-list` command. If the "State" of ``cinder-volume`` is ``up``, that means cinder-volume is OK. .. code-block:: console root@ubuntuL004:/# cinder service-list +------------------+---------------+------+-------+-----+--------------------------+----------------+ |Binary |Host | Zone |Status |State|Updated_at | Disabled Reason| +------------------+---------------+------+-------+-----+--------------------------+----------------+ |cinderscheduler |ubuntuL004 | nova |enabled|up |2016-02-01T16:26:00.000000|- | +------------------+---------------+------+-------+-----+--------------------------+----------------+ |cindervolume |ubuntuL004@v3r3| nova |enabled|up |2016-02-01T16:25:53.000000|- | +------------------+---------------+------+-------+-----+--------------------------+----------------+.. code-block:: xml#. Run the service :command:`cinder-volume restart` command to restart the#. Enable the multipathing switch of the OpenStack Nova module.#. Run the service :command:`nova-compute restart` command to restart theAdjust he driver configuration file as follows:The user name and password are separated by semicolons (;). Configuring multi-storage support --------------------------------- Example for configuring multiple storage systems: storage pools, separate them by semicolons (;).

commit_message:
Fixed python-barbicanclient functional tests.

When using KMIP backend, some barbican client functional
tests failed in payload length validation. Fixed the test case
payload data, for client/v1/functional/test_secrets and
cli/v1/smoke/test_secret

Change-Id: Ic0abe8b6094d838fb4ec33cf22a5ca4c0450de31
Closes-Bug: #1570166
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-barbicanclient refs/changes/76/328876/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: secret.payload = base64.b64encode(payload) secret.payload = base64.b64encode(payload)

while keeping the support for Ubuntu 14.04 with upstart.

commit_message:
Re-deprecate use_usb_tablet config option

The option was originally deprecated in
73d5d1f4618aca3fc5fa9d7cac6ea39b5199a3ca but that was
lost in dda676c80b539e98507cb85a1ce5644f74b755ee.

Let's fix it so we can still save the window for removing
it in Ocata.

Change-Id: Ia3acd7160b6d0043f3d0503812cdafc6850a1323
Closes-Bug: #1593878

commit_message:
Fix gnu tar error handling

Make gnu tar backup and restore error handling work correctly.
Check stderr from gnu tar subprocess for any non-empty string.
Current implementation checks for 'error' string in stderr,
and fails to catch and log errors.

Change sys.exit(1) to os._exit(1) when handling gnu tar error
so that all threads terminate. Currently the process will
hang because all threads are not terminated when a gnu tar
error occurs. os_exit(1) will terminate all threads
and the entire process when a gnu tar error occurs.

Change-Id: Icf265ade8d5e4c9b55aee50faa40334d89d664f1
Closes-Bug: #1591347
(cherry picked from commit 75f2c9db3589e729ac2a522961cc12799eea87db)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/37/329937/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
objects: in get_object(s), filter by fields, not model attributes

This is needed for objects that have fields that have different names
comparing to corresponding attributes in the database. Updated test
cases to reflect that behaviour (pass field filters into object
get_object(s), but expect db_api functions to receive and return model
attributes).

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Change-Id: Ib65922eeaa9573312e3428c748ff415ef600052c

commit_message:
(WIP)DVR: Clean stale snat_namespace with gw_port remove

This patch adds an exists method to the namespace class
so that the namespace can be validated for its existence
and then necessary action can be taken when gateway is
added, removed or updated.

Also do the necessary cleanup of the stale namespaces if
the agent is dead while gateway remove and then when agent
comes alive.

Change-Id: I4ecac248cbb1b7f72158abaa36645b13caab9aa1
Closes-Bug: #1590041
Closes-Bug: #1557909

commit_message:
Add release note for Mongo to Galera changes

The upgrade note describes only that which needs to happen
without specifying details so that an upgrade play in the
integrated repository can be optionally revised into this
message easily. It might also be left unsaid with the
upgrade docs and the upgrade play being self-evident.

Change-Id: I86a2f6f084c3c5de4b506c999eb54531527e8bed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_aodh refs/changes/76/329576/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - The Aodh data migration script should be run to migrate alarm data from MongoDB storage to Galera due to the pending removal of MongoDB support. fixes: - Aodh has deprecated support for NoSQL storage (MongoDB and Cassandra) in Mitaka with removal scheduled for the O* release. This causes warnings in the logs. The default of using MongoDB storage for Aodh is replaced with the use of Galera. Continued use of MongoDB will require the use of vars to specify a correct aodh_connection_string and add pymongo to the aodh_pip_packages list.

commit_message:
Refactor the rpc callback version discovery mechanism

The previous version depended on the AgentDbMixin to be loaded by
any plugin, and also introduced an __init__ on the mixin which
was problematic: mixins are expected to be classes which add methods
to another class, but to implement no constructor. One of the plugins
had one of the elements of MRO not calling to super().__init__ and
hence not triggering this __init__ method.

This change requires the plugins using the rpc callback mechanism
to provide the AgentDbMixin which is used to refresh cache of known
resource consumers (agents) and versions on demand, this way
we make it more clear that the rpc_callback api is currently designed
to be used with agents only, despite of its extensibility to other
areas.

Change-Id: Ie96b52dbe3a1f32cd4c11de8d8a5eff663fbf7f6
Related-Bug: #1584204

commit_message:
Updating README with additional necessary packages

python-pip and python-virtualenv are necessary to run any 'update'
command with autohelp-wrapper, otherwise the script issues a
'command not found' error for pip and virtualenv

Change-Id: I96186764364eaa80a5c73fe6b019b9fd457c57a2

commit_message:
Add segment_id to DHCP Agent Network Bindings

With the concept of segments being introduced, the dhcp agent
scheduler needs to be aware of networks that are made up of segments.
Because networks may or may not be made up of segments,  segment_id is
being added to the networkdhcpagentbindings table as a NULLable column.
It is expected, for now, that every segment MUST have a dhcp agent
scheduled to it, and an agent cannot be scheduled to more than one
segment.  These two stipulations may change in the future, but they
are assumed for now.

Change-Id: If1f38fd8583a99a7b65cdb98b6e2a077ccf20863
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

commit_message:
Clean up container cache prep in tasks

This patch cleans up the container cache preparation in the tests
due to the following patches:

- https://review.openstack.org/307856 (new image build process)

"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-17 22:52:16.000000000', 'files': ['monascaclient/ksclient.py', 'requirements.txt', 'monascaclient/tests/fakes.py', 'README.rst', 'monascaclient/v2_0/client.py', 'monascaclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'client_api_example.py', 'monascaclient/common/http.py', 'monascaclient/shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-monascaclient/commit/32543447ef400fbc2ab8f924de1b89dc5c8316bb', 'message': "Revert 'Adding keystoneauth sessions support'

commit_message:
Revert 'Adding keystoneauth sessions support'

This did not work when OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE was set to internalURL. It
always returned the publicURL.

This also always made a query to keystone for the monasca_api_url
even when the session client did not need it. The extra query will
hurt performance

Change-Id: I3d890949941acc77a17888ec57274d9201eb56a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-monascaclient refs/changes/64/331364/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parser.add_argument('--os-domain-id', default=utils.env('OS_DOMAIN_ID'), help='Defaults to env[OS_DOMAIN_ID].') parser.add_argument('--os_domain_id', parser.add_argument('--os-domain-name', default=utils.env('OS_DOMAIN_NAME'), help='Defaults to env[OS_DOMAIN_NAME].') parser.add_argument('--os_domain_name', 'os_cacert': args.os_cacert, 'domain_id': args.os_domain_id, 'domain_name': args.os_domain_name, if args.os_auth_token: token = args.os_auth_token else: try: token = _ksclient.token except exc.CommandError: raise exc.CommandError( "User does not have a default project. " "You must provide a project id using " "--os-project-id or via env[OS_PROJECT_ID], " "or you must provide a project name using " "--os-project-name or via env[OS_PROJECT_NAME] " "and a project domain using --os-domain-name, via " "env[OS_DOMAIN_NAME], using --os-domain-id or " "via env[OS_DOMAIN_ID]") kwargs = { 'token': token, 'insecure': args.insecure, 'os_cacert': args.os_cacert, 'cert_file': args.cert_file, 'key_file': args.key_file, 'username': args.os_username, 'password': args.os_password, 'service_type': args.os_service_type, 'endpoint_type': args.os_endpoint_type, 'auth_url': args.os_auth_url, 'keystone_timeout': args.keystone_timeout } if args.os_user_domain_name: kwargs['user_domain_name'] = args.os_user_domain_name if args.os_user_domain_id: kwargs['user_domain_id'] = args.os_user_domain_id if args.os_region_name: kwargs['region_name'] = args.os_region_name if args.os_project_name: kwargs['project_name'] = args.os_project_name if args.os_project_id: kwargs['project_id'] = args.os_project_id if args.os_domain_name: kwargs['domain_name'] = args.os_domain_name if args.os_domain_id: kwargs['domain_id'] = args.os_domain_id client = monasca_client.Client(api_version, endpoint, **kwargs)
deleted_lines: parser.add_argument('--os-project-domain-id', default=utils.env('OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_ID'), help='Defaults to env[OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_ID].') parser.add_argument('--os_project_domain_id', parser.add_argument('--os-project-domain-name', default=utils.env('OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME'), help='Defaults to env[OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME].') parser.add_argument('--os_project_domain_name', 'project_domain_id': args.os_project_domain_id, 'project_domain_name': args.os_project_domain_name, 'os_cacert': args.os_cacert, 'cert_file': args.cert_file, 'key_file': args.key_file, session = None # Kept to check whether the token is indeed project scoped try: _ksclient.token except exc.CommandError: raise exc.CommandError( "User does not have a default project. " "You must provide a project id using " "--os-project-id or via env[OS_PROJECT_ID], " "or you must provide a project name using " "--os-project-name or via env[OS_PROJECT_NAME] " "and a project domain using --os-project-domain-name, " "via env[OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME], using " "--os-project-domain-id or via " "env[OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_ID]") session = _ksclient.session if session: client = monasca_client.Client(api_version, session=session) else: client = monasca_client.Client(api_version, endpoint, **kwargs)

commit_message:
Add container connect/disconnect tests to fullstack gate job

implements blueprint: fullstack-testing

Change-Id: I42617524b515f4ccbe06fdde79b093aff56bfbf6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr refs/changes/05/265105/42 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from kuryr.tests.fullstack import kuryr_base class ContainerTest(kuryr_base.KuryrBaseTest): """Test Container related operations Test container connect/disconnect from docker to Neutron """ def test_connect_disconnect_container(self): # Test if support connect/disconnect operations # This will work only with patch #265094 # TODO(baohua) refactor this method later net = self.docker_client.create_network(name='kuryr_test_net', driver='kuryr') net_id = net.get('Id') container = self.docker_client.create_container( image='busybox:latest', command='/bin/sleep 600', hostname='kuryr_test_container', name='kuryr_test_container') warn_msg, container_id = container.get('Warning'), container.get('Id') self.assertEqual(u'', warn_msg, 'Warning when create container') self.assertIsNotNone(container_id, 'Create container id must not ' 'be None') self.docker_client.start(container=container_id) self.docker_client.connect_container_to_network(container_id, net_id) self.docker_client.disconnect_container_from_network(container_id, net_id) self.docker_client.remove_network('kuryr_test_net') def test_connectivity(self): # Test if two containers of the same network can reach each other # TODO(baohua) refactor this method later return

commit_message:
Implement Ubuntu 16.04 support with SystemD

This change updates the aodh role to support Ubuntu 14.04 with
upstart init and 16.04 with a systemd init.

Some tags for tasks are updated to conform to convention as well.

Change-Id: Ice81e049475b31559c861c0d20bcd26867da321c
Implements: blueprint support-ubuntu-1604

commit_message:
Update lists of skipped security role tasks

The security role has fixes for V-38496 that will allow
us to apply this configuration in the gate jobs.

The AIDE issues have also been fixed, so V-38670 should
be able to run in the gate without problems.

Change-Id: Iab369540c1cab0612490ad04fe4ba2e9bfff7028

commit_message:
Updated *_domain_id to "Default"

Previously user_domain_id and project_domain_id was hardcoded to
"default" which causes an error in environments using PostgreSQL or
case-sensirive MySQL as DB backend.

Change-Id: Id8489ad712deebff2248fbf404df255f484a8071
Closes-Bug: #1580611
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/65/324365/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $MURANO_CONF_FILE keystone_authtoken project_domain_name "Default" iniset $MURANO_CONF_FILE keystone_authtoken user_domain_name "Default"

subject: Add simple test for Neutron GET /
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-02 14:04:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/1a1199abb42c66216aec8ce000c9658211a65276', 'message': 'Add simple tests for GET /

A fundamental operation for most OpenStack services is providing
information about what versions of an API are available to clients.
A version document can be retrieved by sending an unauthenticated
GET request to the root URL ("/") for most services, including
Neutron.  This capability is important for discovery in that clients
can learn how to interact with the cloud in question, and DefCore
considers it an important capability for interoperability and has
added similar capabilities to it's Guidelines for other services.[1][2]
As Neutron moves toward microversioning [3], being able to retrieve
a version document will be increasingly important for clients.
However, there are currently no tests for GET /, so DefCore cannot
make this a required Capability.

This patch adds two simple tests for GET / that perform simple
checks on document structure and version information.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/defcore/tree/2016.01.json#n117
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/defcore/tree/2016.01.json#n1379
[3] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/newton-neutron-future-neutron-api

Change-Id: I606b98cb6648bd4dd45f0dfdd634b1012aeae2ac
Closes-Bug: #1577410
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-02 15:33:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/b41ba05d800582fa1d925dfa5a4e629ff32acfc8', 'message': 'Add simple tests for GET /

considers it an important capability for interoperability and has
added similar capabilities to it's Guidelines for other services.[1][2]
As Neutron moves toward microversioning [3], being able to retrieve
a version document will be increasingly important for clients.
However, there are currently no tests for GET /, so DefCore cannot
make this a required Capability.

This patch adds a simple test for GET / that performs checks on
document structure and version information.

commit_message:
Add simple test for Neutron GET /

A fundamental operation for most OpenStack services is providing
information about what versions of an API are available to clients.
A version document can be retrieved by sending an unauthenticated
GET request to the root URL ("/") for most services, including
Neutron.  This capability is important for discovery in that clients
can learn how to interact with the cloud in question, and DefCore
considers it an important capability for interoperability and has
added similar capabilities to it's Guidelines for other services.[1][2]
As Neutron moves toward microversioning [3], being able to retrieve
a version document will be increasingly important for clients.
However, there are currently no tests for GET /, so DefCore cannot
make this a required Capability.

This patch adds a simple test for GET / that performs checks on
document structure and version information.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/defcore/tree/2016.01.json#n117
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/defcore/tree/2016.01.json#n1379
[3] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/newton-neutron-future-neutron-api

Closes-Bug: #1577410

Change-Id: I606b98cb6648bd4dd45f0dfdd634b1012aeae2ac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/47/311747/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 VMware, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.api.network import base from tempest import test class NetworksApiDiscovery(base.BaseNetworkTest): @test.attr(type='smoke') @test.idempotent_id('bdf8183d-5dbf-4633-98b8-e892f987a79b') def test_list_api_versions(self): """Test that a GET request to / returns proper API versions. Clients that want to use OpenStack services need to know what versions of the API are available to them. They can discover the versions available by sending an unauthenticated GET request for the unversioned root URL. This simple capability is important for interoperability in that clients must have a way to discover how to interact with a given cloud. """ result = self.network_versions_client.list_versions() versions = result['versions'] # There is currently only one version of the API... self.assertEqual(len(versions), 1) # ...and it is v2.0. self.assertEqual(versions[0]['id'], 'v2.0', "The first available version should be v2.0") @test.attr(type='smoke') @test.idempotent_id('cac8a836-c2e0-4304-b556-cd299c7281d1') def test_api_version_resources(self): """Test that GET / returns expected resources. The versions document returned by Neutron returns a few other resources other than just available API versions: it also states the status of each API version and provides links to schema. """ result = self.network_versions_client.list_versions() expected_versions = ('v2.0') expected_resources = ('id', 'links', 'status') received_list = result.values() for item in received_list: for version in item: for resource in expected_resources: self.assertIn(resource, version) self.assertIn(version['id'], expected_versions)

pipeline.

"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-16 22:31:57.000000000', 'files': ['kolla_kubernetes/service.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes/commit/7123c7978e1373eadd90ba10d41812adba111d3e', 'message': "Create ConfigMaps with dashes instead of underscores

commit_message:
Create ConfigMaps with dashes instead of underscores

Kubernetes doesn't like underscores in ConfigMap files.  We can't
change all of the config files, especially if that's what the
process running inside of the container wants.  Thus, we create
them with dashes replacing the underscores and then fix it when
we create the configmap.

Change-Id: I530fbd530814da221e85932a8b88651aa122ce7d

commit_message:
enable installation as an alternate region

Change-Id: I784bf6830e7ae254c0e843f4435adc5cfe239e1f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-specs refs/changes/49/284449/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Enable installation as additonal region ################################# :date: 2016-02-24 22:40 :tags: regions, keystone This spec purposes a way to allow installation of openstack as a different region on a pre-existing keystone database. Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: * https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+spec/enable-installation-as-alternate-region Problem description =================== * The existing playbook makes deploying a new cluster a breeze, but does not offer any solution where operators want to deploy a new cluster while keeping the same username and password for the end-user. * Due to various reasons of legacy choices and code changes, upgrading an existing cluster is not always possible. * No one wants to touch and break an already (old) production cluster. * Moving to a new platform means a new business case, migration decisions, issueing new username and password to existing users, new UUID mapping for billing on both old and new platfrom etc etc etc .. lots of headaches and decisions that forces operators to continue using the same platform. Proposed change =============== * Install everything as normal, except add the endpoints to an existing keystone database as a new region. Alternatives ------------ * alternate way is to create a regions.txt or mapping.txt with keystone queries which the operator can issue on his existing cluster and get the new cluster added as a new region. Playbook/Role impact -------------------- * some extra variables on the yml file. Upgrade impact -------------- * upgrade needs to check existing keystone database if it can be upgraded. Security impact --------------- * this adds additonal endpoints to a keystone database. * if a upgrade of the keystone database is required, then a backup/rollback test must be performed first, or this can be left to the oprator and just a keystone command file created that the operator can copy-paste to add the endpoints himself to an existing cluster. Performance impact ------------------ n/a End user impact --------------- the end user sees the new cluster a new region. Deployer impact --------------- * additional ability -- install as new cluster, or a new region in an existing cluster Developer impact ---------------- n/a Dependencies ------------ * dependent on existing functional keystone of the operator Implementation ============== * explained in the blueprint Assignee(s) ----------- TBD Work items ---------- TBD Testing ======= TBD Documentation impact ==================== n/a References ========== irc: admin0 for use cases

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/62/330762/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: `MariaDB <https://mariadb.org/>_ is the default persistant storage option for `a Kolla-Kubernetes cluster.MariaDB is self-sufficent, thus it's one of the first things you want to start while installing. MariaDB must be boostrapped to set up the on-disk data structure before the process can start. To bootstrap MariaDB::To create the Replication Controller that will keep MariaDB running after boostrap has completed::To find the database password:: grep ^database_password /etc/kolla/passwords.yml To find the IP address of the kubernetes service so you can test for functionality on a machine inside of the Kubernetes cluster (e.g. running Kube-proxy) but not running as a container:: kubectl get svc mariadb Once you know the IP address and password, you can check to see if a mysql client running on a machine by appending the IP address to this command (e.g. -h 192.0.2.0):: mysql -p -u root -hMariaDB is configured to store it's database on the host at ``/var/lib/mysql``. If there's contents from previous runs located there, the bootstrap will fail. Until `patch 320744 <https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320744/>`_ is merged, you will need to build your own MariaDB container.
deleted_lines: `MariaDB <https://mariadb.org/>`_ is the default persistant storage option for a Kolla-Kubernetes cluster.MariaDB is self-sufficent, thus it's one of the first things you want to start while installing. MariaDB must be boostrapped to set up the on-disk data structure before the process can start. To bootstrap MariaDB::To create the Replication Controller that will keep MariaDB running after boostrap has completed::TODO: Fill in more detailsMariaDB is configured to store it's database on the host at ``/var/lib/mysql``. If there's contents from previous runs located there, the bootstrap will fail. Until `patch 320744 <https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320744/>`_ is merged, you will need to build your own MariaDB container.

commit_message:
Create Rabbitmq admin user for web administration

This patch enables rabbitmq_server role to create an admin user for the
web management UI.  The user is only created if a
rabbitmq_admin_pasword variable is defined.

New variables created:

rabbitmq_admin_user
rabbitmq_admin_password

Change-Id: I2a2a8d042cf28600fee15df2504d5eed7ad380ef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server refs/changes/72/276672/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: rabbitmq_admin_user: admin rabbitmq_admin_password: secret

commit_message:
HAProxy backend for RabbitMQ web ui

This patch creates a backend on HAProxy for the RabbitMQ management web ui
frontend port: 15672
backend port: 15672

Change-Id: I29dff531d05f07e2d0efa702deb3178f619a6c0f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/12/276712/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - service: haproxy_service_name: rabbitmq_ui haproxy_backend_nodes: "{{ groups['rabbitmq_all'] | default([]) }}" haproxy_port: 15672 haproxy_balance_type: http haproxy_backend_options: - "httpchk" - "httplog"

commit_message:
Add compute node on the go

While working on multi-node network, when we need more
computation power, it is difficult to add compute node.
So we wish to provide a way to automatically add compute
node on the go.

Change-Id: I81155d9e5b6760d4ab0adcbe7519320a1344c122
Implements: blueprint Add compute node on the go
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-specs refs/changes/35/305635/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================================================== Add Compute node on the go ======================================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+spec/ add-compute-node-on-the-go We need to provide a way to support for adding new compute node on the go through openstack ansible. Problem description =================== While working on multi-node network, when we need more computation power, it is difficult to add compute node. Always we have to do it manually. So we wish to provide a mechanism so that we can do it through openstack-ansible so that we can add more computing power to the VM without manual intervention of the user. A template needs to feed into the orchestration tool(eg: heat) that will add new compute node into the openstack system without impacting the currently running VMs. Use Cases ---------- The Administrator will use this feature to add more computation power and make the VMs work as expected in case when scaling of VM is required and computation power is limited. Proposed change =============== A python file needs to be created on the controller node that will make the new compute node up and do all the setup functions like (updating the host file of Controller, Network). It will run the required commands to add the compute node on the controller node. For verification, we will check the controller node logs and in the logs if we get notification of the resource allocated to compute node , then compute node would be attached. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Atul Agarwal Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- None Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Since this add new capability to the user to add more computation power so new testcases will be required to support them. Documentation Impact ==================== Documentation will be written describing how to create new compute node on the go. References ========== None History ======= None

commit_message:
Added role for mounting the drives in swift object

Currently in any of the release of openstack-ansible (swift),
I don't find any role to mount the drives in swift object server nodes.
I think if the user knows the type of the file system that is
going to be used, we can mount the drives as well using
the playbook without manual intervention.

Change-Id: Iec9b0df9300b7b334f89a680cba06e30ec67af6f
Closes-Bug: #1535536
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/78/317278/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This two options are new to cater the # swift_storage_mount_drives role. device_path: 'opt' # The device path in the machine filesystem_to_mount: 'xfs' # Filesystem to format drive

commit_message:
modify how services are configured in haproxy

Currently haproxy play add all services to its
configurations even in the case where some will
not be deployed later. To remove this issue,
this patch brings the haproxy service
configurations at the beggining of each service
installation playbook.

Change-Id: I74e51fb116ece266384d8588ad0ef125b3eed6a2

commit_message:
Execute rabbitmq sorts for config tags

This fix executes the rabbitmq deterministic sorting
while using the product-config tag, e.g. nova-config
in order rewrite the OpenStack configs (nova/neutron etc)

Change-Id: If47e7b7abea61d3e7a00fe217a6181f8f03c5f7b
Closes-Bug: #1575297
(cherry picked from commit e22641abbf30ac7b0c6c6abdaded131731c4932c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/04/310804/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tags: - always tags: - always

subject: Store openstack_host_systat_enabled as lower case value for sysstat.default.j2
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-25 21:24:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/ec6c197a88bb39124ddbc7eace1d1a8bc6348e4e', 'message': 'Store openstack_host_sysstat_enabled as lower case value for sysstat.default.j2

Sysstat won't enable unless the ENABLED switch has been set to true.
Passing openstack_host_sysstat_enabled as true inside jinja will end
up as a "True" value inside the /etc/default/sysstat rather then the
expected "true" value and sysstat won't start.

The added jinja filter lower will make sure that the boolean is always
stored in lower case.

Additionally 'openstack_host_systat_enabled' was renamed to
'openstack_host_sysstat_enabled' to better reflect the dependency to
sysstat.

This is a backport of https://review.openstack.org/263427

commit_message:
Store openstack_host_systat_enabled as lower case value for sysstat.default.j2

Sysstat won't enable unless the ENABLED switch has been set to true.
Passing openstack_host_systat_enabled as true inside jinja will end
up as a "True" value inside the /etc/default/sysstat rather then the
expected "true" value and sysstat won't start.

The added jinja filter lower will make sure that the boolean is always
stored in lower case.

This is a backport of https://review.openstack.org/263427

Co-Authored-By: Bjoern Teipel <bjoern.teipel@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: I4c8ac77c29ae4f3a1f6331fdaaab5d45abadcf44
Closes-Bug: #1530979

commit_message:
Added role for mounting the drives in swift object

Currently in any of the release of openstack-ansible (swift),
I don't find any role to mount the drives in swift object server nodes.
I think if the user knows the type of the file system that is
going to be used, we can mount the drives as well using
the playbook without manual intervention.

Change-Id: I6d590677bbe3ea763eecebad2128f0dbd80e7563
Closes-Bug: #1535536
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift refs/changes/52/317252/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- # Copyright 2014, Rackspace US, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. #This role is to mount the drives in swift object node and is optional. #This gets executed only when the flag 'mount_drives' in swift configuration #file is set to true. # We need swift_vars to exist for the "swift_vars.drives is defined check" to work - name: "Set swift_vars if undefined" set_fact: swift_vars: "{}" when: swift_vars is not defined # This creates the mount point directory - name: "Create mount point directory" file: state: "directory" path: "{{ swift_vars.mount_point | default(swift.mount_point) }}/{{ item.name }}" with_items: swift_vars.drives when: swift_vars.drives is defined - name: "Create mount point directory" file: state: "directory" path: "{{ swift_vars.mount_point | default(swift.mount_point) }}/{{ item.name }}" with_items: swift.drives when: swift_vars.drives is not defined # This formats to the specified file system like xfs, mentioned in the configuration # file. - commit_message:
Add note on admin_token_auth deprecation

The admin_token_auth middleware has been deprecated. Include a note
informing users and providing instructions on removing it from
keystone's WSGI pipelines.

Closes-Bug: 1586159
Change-Id: I4ec9e6f098585ddbfcfb7ee826e582af7a12c734
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/51/330251/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- security: - The admin_token_auth middleware presents a potential security risk and will be removed in a future release of keystone. Its use can be removed by setting the ``keystone_keystone_paste_ini_overrides`` variable. :: keystone_keystone_paste_ini_overrides: pipeline:public_api: pipeline: cors sizelimit osprofiler url_normalize request_id build_auth_context token_auth json_body ec2_extension public_service pipeline:admin_api: pipeline: cors sizelimit osprofiler url_normalize request_id build_auth_context token_auth json_body ec2_extension s3_extension admin_service pipeline:api_v3: pipeline: cors sizelimit osprofiler url_normalize request_id build_auth_context token_auth json_body ec2_extension_v3 s3_extension service_v3

commit_message:
Address Ansible bare variable usage

When executing the role with Ansible 2.1, the following
deprecation warning is issued in the output for some tasks.

[DEPRECATION WARNING]: Using bare variables is deprecated.

This patch addresses the tasks to fix the behaviour appropriately.

Change-Id: Iae8779854b7d07eddd5e990f8fb18177f7afb760

subject: Add index on trunk_id in the subports model
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-07 18:31:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/953dda393ce97437862ef311b1657c4ad01845fa', 'message': "Add index on trunk_id in the subports model

This model will be better served with an index on trunk_id than having
trunk_id in the primary key.  Since it was the second column in the
primary key, it wasn't efficient to look up sub ports by trunk only
without supplying port_id.  An explicit index on trunk_id is
efficient.

Given that, I don't think there is any reason to have trunk_id in the
primary_key at all.  So, this patch drops it.  That makes the unique
and nullable properties of port_id redundant.  It is more intuitive to
me for port_id alone to be the primary key on this table anyway.

Change-Id: I566863fd44aa402230d2eb83e99bc66e7fed8d80
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-08 00:04:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/fe25eda16a01bc9c2f8cf5fce64c0dfb8134a407', 'message': "Add index on trunk_id in the subports model

This model will be better served with an index on trunk_id than having
trunk_id in the primary key.  Since it was the second column in the
primary key, it wasn't efficient to look up sub ports by trunk only
without supplying port_id.  An explicit index on trunk_id is
efficient.

I wish I could write a migration to remove trunk_id from the primary
key but it seems that is impossible.  We'll have to live with it in
the primary key even though it doesn't really make sense to me and it
doesn't help us out at all.

Change-Id: I566863fd44aa402230d2eb83e99bc66e7fed8d80
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-08 15:15:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2cfa245a8c396c891b502653eb62ae22fcc528e1', 'message': "Add index on trunk_id in the subports model

This model will be better served with an index on trunk_id than having
trunk_id in the primary key.  Since it was the second column in the
primary key, it wasn't efficient to look up sub ports by trunk only
without supplying port_id.  An explicit index on trunk_id is
efficient.

Ideally, we could write a migration to remove trunk_id from the
primary key but it seems that is not allowed by alembic.  We'll have
to live with it in the primary key even though it doesn't really model
anything useful.

Change-Id: I566863fd44aa402230d2eb83e99bc66e7fed8d80
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-09 00:14:47.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/trunk/models.py', 'neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/EXPAND_HEAD', 'neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/newton/expand/0e877ec3cba3_add_index_to_trunk_model_and_adjust_.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/6d8d00fea1021cb50087bebf051b7795cda1978d', 'message': "Add index on trunk_id in the subports model

An index on trunk_id will make queries that return subports from a given
trunk_id efficient.  When I first approved the trunk and subports model,
I thought that having trunk_id in the primary key would be sufficient.
However, thinking about it some more, I realize that isn't the case
because trunk_id is listed as the second column in the primary key.

Think about it like searching a string index for something that matches
in the last half of a string.  The index doesn't make that efficient.
The DB must still search all entries for matches.  It is the same with
the index on (port_id, trunk_id) that the primary key provides.  You
need to look through every row to find matching trunk_ids.  Hence the
addition of an index.

Change-Id: I566863fd44aa402230d2eb83e99bc66e7fed8d80
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
"}]
commit_message:
Add index on trunk_id in the subports model

An index on trunk_id will make queries that return subports from a given
trunk_id efficient.  When I first approved the trunk and subports model,
I thought that having trunk_id in the primary key would be sufficient.
However, thinking about it some more, I realize that isn't the case
because trunk_id is listed as the second column in the primary key.

Think about it like searching a string index for something that matches
in the last half of a string.  The index doesn't make that efficient.
The DB must still search all entries for matches.  It is the same with
the index on (port_id, trunk_id) that the primary key provides.  You
need to look through every row to find matching trunk_ids.  Hence the
addition of an index.

Change-Id: I566863fd44aa402230d2eb83e99bc66e7fed8d80
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/89/326689/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Add index on trunk_id to subports model Important note about this migration. It isn't possible to drop trunk_id from the primary key in a migration as far as I can tell. It doesn't hurt to have it in the primary key because the port_id is unique already and so the combination of (port_id, trunk_id) must also be unique. This migration is also careful not to drop the index on port_id which was created by the "unique" attribute because dropping that index and failing to drop trunk_id from the primary key would lose the ability to enforce uniqueness of port_id. Since this model doesn't yet appear in a final release of Neutron, the number of deployments with these differences will be minimal. """ revision = '0e877ec3cba3' down_revision = '30107ab6a3ee' from alembic import op def upgrade(): op.create_index('ix_subports_trunk_id', 'subports', ['trunk_id'], unique=False)

commit_message:
Add an easy way to run cmds in utility container

This patch adds a simple script that makes it easy to run
commands in a utility container on localhost. It's most useful
for an AIO installation.

Change-Id: I55a746bc61d78db04381162abac09062f1f48032
Signed-off-by: Michael Davies <michael@the-davies.net>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/00/326200/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env bash # # Copyright 2016, Rackspace US, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. # What this script is for: # This script runs the supplied commands in the utility container on # localhost. It simplifies performing actions from the utility # container. __check_cmd_avail () { if [ "z$(which $1)" == "z" ]; then echo "The command '$1' could not be found, exiting" exit 1 fi } # Make sure we're running as root if [[ $EUID -ne 0 ]]; then echo "This script must be run as root. Exiting..." 2>&1 exit 1 fi # Ensure a command was provided if [ $# -eq 0 ]; then echo "Usage: $(basename $0) <command>" exit 1 fi LXCATTACH="lxc-attach" LXCLS="lxc-ls" # Verify we have the commands we need __check_cmd_avail ${LXCATTACH} __check_cmd_avail ${LXCLS} # Find the container to execute in UTIL=$(${LXCLS} | grep utility) if [ "z${UTIL}" == "z" ]; then echo "*** Couldn't find your utility container. Exiting..." exit 1 fi ${LXCATTACH} -n ${UTIL} -- bash -c ". /root/openrc && $*"

commit_message:
Disable root private key distribution by the utility playbook

There is no clear need for this behavior so it has been disabled
by default. A new var: ``utility_ssh_private_key`` has been
introduced for deployers who desire this behavior.

Change-Id: Iac51d667e19a0cabd825714dc90da73eef9c6992
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/35/330535/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: - name: Grab private ssh key set_fact: private_ssh_key: "{{ lookup('file', '/root/.ssh/id_rsa') }}" - name: Drop in private ssh key copy: content: "{{ private_ssh_key }}"

commit_message:
Remove libvirt bootstrapping from AIO

With the implementation of I83e3fc349a0448e0411f369bdf4888ff81cb37a8
the libvirt bootstrapping of the AIO is no longer needed.

Change-Id: I83080a145bb86d45e61623f879d41ddf91cff8b4
Closes-Bug: 1589440

This enables nova # live migration for 64bit guest OSes on heterogenous cloud "hardware". export BOOTSTRAP_OPTS="${BOOTSTRAP_OPTS} bootstrap_host_libvirt_config=yes" fi

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: Allocate IP addresses backwards to flush out tests reliant on sequential allocation

This patch is intended to simply smoke out any tests that may still
be assuming sequential allocation of IP addresses by the IPAM subsystem.

Not intended to be merged.

Change-Id: Icf22524a729345adc348ad89db1ea8f73eb10a23

commit_message:
Move CLI options to cmd.server

These options where in the bootstrap module for historical reasons,
IIRC. Now it seems to be of no use to have them there.

Change-Id: I8af3bfd9549ff69954381143b01f1dfa3254d71d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/21/326421/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from zaqar.common import configs _CLI_OPTIONS = ( configs._ADMIN_MODE_OPT, cfg.BoolOpt('daemon', default=False, help='Run Zaqar server in the background.'), ) conf.register_cli_opts(_CLI_OPTIONS)

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-10 06:26:17.000000000', 'files': ['tests/ci/rally-gate.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/633d0ff464553882143e6432f3c7423c0b75b407', 'message': 'Revert "Gate: prepopulate cluster with one server"

This reverts commit 994ed06f64577fd1e719852047b72f95600561e5
(and its follow-up, b861c0cd4259deac7a0d371436006d78957ec47c)
because it broke gate-networking-midonet-v2-rally-dsvm-nv job.

In midonet, typically admin tenant has two networks,
the usual "public" and midonet-specific "uplink".
booting a VM without specifying a network fails with

as listing security groups is enough to populate the default
security groups for the tenant.

Closes-Bug: #1589876

'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Gate: prepopulate cluster with one server"

This reverts commit 994ed06f64577fd1e719852047b72f95600561e5
(and its follow-up, b861c0cd4259deac7a0d371436006d78957ec47c)
because it broke gate-networking-midonet-v2-rally-dsvm-nv job.

In midonet, typically admin tenant has two networks,
the usual "public" and midonet-specific "uplink".
booting a VM without specifying a network fails with
"Multiple possible networks" error there.

The reasoning of the original commit is rather unclear to me,
as listing security groups is enough to populate the default
security groups for the tenant.

Closes-Bug: #1589876
Change-Id: Ia90a8f4a68f558205ddae87c0a3c2ff0bdc89945
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/93/328093/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # TODO(stpierre): We should prepopulate the cluster with a wide # variety of resources to ensure that Rally cleanup isn't overzealous, # but in the meantime this solves an issue with resource # comparison. When the first instance is booted, default security # groups are created in the 'service' tenant, and they were being # reported (erroneously) in the resource comparison. This forces # creation of those security groups before we record the initial # resources, and also starts us along the path of prepopulating # resources. nova boot --image cirros-0.3.4-x86_64-uec --flavor m1.tiny --poll test-server

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-28 22:18:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/a274ee170ae203284ef2b8de9e8e500251651fe4', 'message': 'Add condition to local IP for overlay net

The change adds a conditional to the setting of the intra
play local IP evaluation from ansible facts. This conditional
is needed in cases where the deployment will not have an overlay
network available to the instances. In cases where there is no
overlay network The default local IP will be set as 127.0.0.1
which is the default address.

commit_message:
Add conditional for overlay network settings

A conditional has been added to the ``_local_ip`` settings used in
the ``neutron_local_ip`` which removes the hard requirement for an
overlay network to be set within a deployment. If no overlay network
is set within the deployment the ``local_ip`` will be set to the
value of ``ansible_ssh_host``.

Change-Id: I954a46443b5434b589226c4999e71bd6ba6a5c0b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

added_lines: when: - is_metal | bool - _overlay_network.bridge is defined when: - not is_metal | bool - _overlay_network.address is defined neutron_local_ip: "{{ _local_ip|default('127.0.0.1') }}"
deleted_lines: when: is_metal | bool when: not is_metal | bool neutron_local_ip: "{{ _local_ip }}"

commit_message:
[admin-guide] Edits the "Manage the cloud" topic

Changes nova client commands to openstack client.
Points to client install rather than re-documenting
install.

Change-Id: I7946cde6bb9d9dc8a8943f04a543cc95ad524d8a
Closes-bug: 1593858
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/36/331336/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: System administrators can use the :command:`openstack` and :command:`euca2ools` commands to manage their clouds. the ``openstack`` client and ``euca2ools`` can be used by all users, though specific commands might be restricted by the Identity service. **Managing the cloud with the openstack client** #. The ``python-openstackclient`` package provides an ``openstack`` shell that enables Compute API interactions from the command line. Install the client, and provide your user name and password (which can be set as environment To install python-openstackclient, follow the instructions in the `OpenStack User Guide <http://docs.openstack.org/user-guide/common/cli_install_openstack_command_line_clients.html>`_. $ openstack help usage: openstack [--version] [-v | -q] [--log-file LOG_FILE] [-h] [--debug] [--os-cloud <cloud-config-name>] [--os-region-name <auth-region-name>] [--os-cacert <ca-bundle-file>] [--verify | --insecure] [--os-default-domain <auth-domain>] ... Running :command:`openstack help` returns a list of ``openstack`` commands and parameters. To get help for a subcommand, run: $ openstack help SUBCOMMAND For a complete list of ``openstack`` commands and parameters, see the <http://docs.openstack.org/cli-reference/openstack.html>`__. commands easier. For example, you can add :option:`--os-username` as an ``openstack`` option, or set it as an environment variable. To set the user#. The Identity service gives you an authentication endpoint,
deleted_lines: System administrators can use :command:`nova` client and :command:`euca2ools` commands to manage their clouds. ``nova`` client and ``euca2ools`` can be used by all users, though specific commands might be restricted by Role Based Access Control in the Identity service. **Managing the cloud with nova client** #. The ``python-novaclient`` package provides a ``nova`` shell that enables Compute API interactions from the command line. Install the client, and provide your user name and password (which can be set as environment To install python-novaclient, download the tarball from `http://pypi.python.org/pypi/python-novaclient/#downloads <http://pypi.python.org/pypi/python-novaclient/#downloads>`__ and then install it in your favorite Python environment: .. code-block:: console $ curl -O http://pypi.python.org/packages/source/p/python-novaclient/python-novaclient-2.6.3.tar.gz $ tar -zxvf python-novaclient-2.6.3.tar.gz $ cd python-novaclient-2.6.3 As root, run: .. code-block:: console # python setup.py install $ nova help usage: nova [--version] [--debug] [--os-cache] [--timings] [--timeout SECONDS] [--os-username AUTH_USER_NAME] [--os-password AUTH_PASSWORD] [--os-tenant-name AUTH_TENANT_NAME] [--os-tenant-id AUTH_TENANT_ID] [--os-auth-url AUTH_URL] [--os-region-name REGION_NAME] [--os-auth-system AUTH_SYSTEM] [--service-type SERVICE_TYPE] [--service-name SERVICE_NAME] [--volume-service-name VOLUME_SERVICE_NAME] [--endpoint-type ENDPOINT_TYPE] [--os-compute-api-version COMPUTE_API_VERSION] [--os-cacert CA_CERTIFICATE] [--insecure] [--bypass-url BYPASS_URL] SUBCOMMAND ... Running :command:`nova help` returns a list of ``nova`` commands and parameters. To get help for a subcommand, run: $ nova help SUBCOMMAND For a complete list of ``nova`` commands and parameters, see the <http://docs.openstack.org/cli-reference/nova.html>`__. commands easier. For example, you can add :option:`--os-username` as a ``nova`` option, or set it as an environment variable. To set the user#. The Identity service will give you an authentication endpoint, $ export NOVA_VERSION=1.1

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/51/331351/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: the covers. In either case, you can use the ``openstack`` CLI to manage.. list-table:: **openstack volume commands** * - server add volume * - volume create * - volume delete - Remove or delete a volume. * - server remove volume - Detach or remove a volume from a server. * - volume list * - volume show * - snapshot create * - snapshot delete * - snapshot list * - snapshot show * - volume type create * - volume type delete * - volume type listFor example, to list IDs and names of volumes, run: $ openstack volume list +--------+--------------+-----------+------+-------------+ | ID | Display Name | Status | Size | Attached to | +--------+--------------+-----------+------+-------------+ | 86e6cb | testnfs | available | 1 | | | e389f7 | demo | available | 1 | | +--------+--------------+-----------+------+-------------+
deleted_lines: the covers. In either case, you can use the ``nova`` CLI to manage.. list-table:: **nova volume commands** * - volume-attach * - volume-create * - volume-delete - Remove a volume. * - volume-detach - Detach a volume from a server. * - volume-list * - volume-show * - volume-snapshot-create * - volume-snapshot-delete * - volume-snapshot-list * - volume-snapshot-show * - volume-type-create * - volume-type-delete * - volume-type-list * - volume-update - Update an attached volume.For example, to list IDs and names of Compute volumes, run: $ nova volume-list +-----------+-----------+--------------+------+-------------+-------------+ | ID | Status | Display Name | Size | Volume Type | Attached to | +-----------+-----------+--------------+------+-------------+-------------+ | 1af4cb9...| available | PerfBlock | 1 | Performance | | +-----------+-----------+--------------+------+-------------+-------------+

[admin-guide] Adds additional commands to Manage quotas so it can standalone

Otherwise user has to click through multiple sections when
they may simply want to get help for the openstack client command.

Idempotent id's for tempest tests must be unique, as it's used to trace
tests even in the event of refactors [1].

This patch adds a new check using check-uuid tool from tempest to
validate id uniqueness. This adds a new test-only dependency to pull in
tempest from PyPI to make pep8 tox target work.

Also, the duplicate idempotent id's in our tests have been fixed.

[1]
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/HACKING.html#test-identification-with-idempotent-id

validate id uniqueness. This adds a new test-only dependency to pull in

Also, the duplicate idempotent id's in our tests have been fixed.

[1]
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/HACKING.html#test-identification-with-idempotent-id

Change-Id: Ie92e4576d9ce6c26f19bdd668426c71a62409e7a

commit_message:
Add sanity check for idempotent id's in tempest tests

Idempotent id's for tempest tests must be unique, as it's used to trace
tests even in the event of refactors [1].

This patch adds a new check using check-uuid tool from tempest to
validate id uniqueness. This adds a new test-only dependency to pull in
tempest from PyPI to make pep8 tox target work.

Also, the duplicate idempotent id's in our tests have been fixed.

[1]
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/HACKING.html#test-identification-with-idempotent-id

Co-Authored-By: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie92e4576d9ce6c26f19bdd668426c71a62409e7a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/83/300483/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _idempotent_api_dups() { neutron_path=$(cd "$(dirname "$0")/.." && pwd) grep @test.idempotent_id $neutron_path/neutron/tests/api/ -R \ | sort | uniq -d } check_no_duplicate_api_test_idempotent_ids() { # For API tests, an idempotent ID is assigned to each single API test, # those IDs should be unique n_dups=$(_idempotent_api_dups | wc --lines) if [ "$n_dups" != "0" ]; then echo "There are duplicate idempotent ids in the API tests" >>$FAILURES echo "please, assign unique uuids to each API test:" >>$FAILURES _idempotent_api_dups >>$FAILURES fi } check_no_duplicate_api_test_idempotent_ids

commit_message:
Macro install packages

Simplification of package installations

Change-Id: I78c0a84c55e891dec7c9bd21bc61700dba244526
Partially-implements: blueprint third-party-plugin-support
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/34/326734/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% macro install_packages(packages) -%} {% if base_distro in ['centos', 'fedora', 'oraclelinux', 'rhel'] -%} yum -y install {% for package in packages %}{{ package }} {% endfor %} && yum clean all {%- elif base_distro in ['ubuntu', 'debian'] -%} apt-get -y install --no-install-recommends {% for package in packages %}{{ package }} {% endfor %} && apt-get clean {%- endif %} {%- endmacro %}

commit_message:
Update Aodh integration

The Aodh integration with Ceilometer no longer relies on Ceilometer
connecting directly to an alarm storage engine to answer API calls,
when Aodh is enabled. Instead it will redirect requests related to
alarms to Aodh.

Depends-On: I440b4c8127eff2dc517d7ff8e277c6d7a5f106ce
Change-Id: I4a3f6b69b6b19118248c383c1d58c99e1a7f8262
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ceilometer refs/changes/05/329705/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- other: - Ceilometer no longer manages alarm storage when Aodh is enabled. It now redirects alarm-related requests to the Aodh API. This is now auto-enabled when Aodh is deployed. upgrade: - Overrides for ceilometer aodh_connection_string will no longer work. fixes: - Specifying an Aodh connection string in Ceilometer was deprecated within Ceilometer in a prior release so this option has been removed.

commit_message:
Pin test-requirements to match OpenStack requirements

A new release of flake8 is causing lint faiures. Our requirements
should match OpenStack requirements anyway.

This patch pins to the current master requirements from the
OpenStack requirements repository using global-requirements.

Change-Id: I555e134ff758ebd5da3cb92882bcc621ac551dd9
