due to the following patches:

- https://review.openstack.org/307856 (new image build process)

- https://review.openstack.org/322188 (new resolver config process)

OpenStack requirements repository using global-requirements.

commit_message:
Auto-enable Ceilometer + Aodh integration

Ceilometer can conditionally delegate and redirect all alarm related
activity to Aodh. This can now be auto-enabled through this variable
combined with the related change in the os_ceilometer role. A
deployers can force-disable this integration by overriding the var.

Related Change: I4a3f6b69b6b19118248c383c1d58c99e1a7f8262

Change-Id: I440b4c8127eff2dc517d7ff8e277c6d7a5f106ce

added_lines: ceilometer_aodh_enabled: groups['aodh_all'] is defined and groups['aodh_all'] | length > 0

commit_message:
os.path.realpath should be replace by linuxscsi.get_name_from_path

Since os-brick has a function linuxscsi.get_name_from_path to translate
/dev/disk/by-path/ entry to /dev/sdX, so os.path.realpath should be replace
by linuxscsi.get_name_from_path.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I34a03d5a91160182ea0279d777bfa82b233ca601
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/91/331391/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: device_realpath = self._linuxscsi.get_name_from_path( host_device) entry_real_path = self._linuxscsi.get_name_from_path( "/dev/disk/by-path/%s" % entry) self.device_name = self._linuxscsi.get_name_from_path( device)
deleted_lines: device_realpath = os.path.realpath(host_device) entry_real_path = os.path.realpath("/dev/disk/by-path/%s" % entry) self.device_name = os.path.realpath(device)

commit_message:
Remove some options from neutron-db-manage

Remove these CLI options:
 --core_plugin : deprecated, not used
 --service : deprecated in favor of --subproject
 --sql_connection : deprecated in favor of --database-connection

Related-Bug: #1501380

Change-Id: Iff1babbb29d43dd0d4fed653de4714ca0ff75a99

Add kolla-kubernetes bootstap logic endpoint script

Kolla-kubernetes will setup the endpoints after the bootstrap is
complete.

Closes-bug: #1589282

Partially-implements: blueprint kolla-kubernetes-extended-dockerfiles

added_lines: #***** KOLLA-KUBERNETES ***** KUBE_TOKEN=$(</var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/token) bootstrap_url=$(curl -sSk -H "Authorization: Bearer $KUBE_TOKEN" https://$KUBERNETES_SERVICE_HOST:$KUBERNETES_PORT_443_TCPORT/api/v1/namespaces/default/pods | grep /api/v1/namespaces/default/pods/keystone-bootstrap | cut -d '"' -f 4) || true KEYSTONE_BOOTSTRAPPED=$(curl -sSk -H "Authorization: Bearer $KUBE_TOKEN" https://$KUBERNETES_SERVICE_HOST:$KUBERNETES_PORT_443_TCPORT$bootstrap_url | python -c 'import json,sys;obj=json.load(sys.stdin);print obj["status"]["phase"]') || KEYSTONE_BOOTSTRAPPED='Succeeded' echo `curl -sSk -H "Authorization: Bearer $KUBE_TOKEN" https://$KUBERNETES_SERVICE_HOST:$KUBERNETES_PORT_443_TCPORT$bootstrap_url` if [[ "$KEYSTONE_BOOTSTRAPPED" == "false" ]]; then echo "Keystone bootstrapping isn't complete" exit 1 fi #***** KOLLA-KUBERNETES *****

commit_message:
Provide way to "initialise" oslo.privsep

Specifically, the goal here is to provide a default that can use
rootwrap.

This change implements a `priv_context.init` function that allows
oslo.privsep to hook into the startup of programs using oslo.privsep.
The intention is to call this function near the top of main() - after
oslo.config is available but before anything "interesting" is performed.

In this change, this init function just allows you to set the default
"run as root" prefix for helper_command to include something like
rootwrap.

In the future, it is expected to use this same call point to do other
"early" tasks like immediately forking privileged helpers and dropping
root if already running as root.

Change-Id: I3ea73e16b07a870629e7d69e897f2524d7068ae8
Partial-Bug: #1592043
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.privsep refs/changes/66/329766/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import shleximport weakreffrom oslo_utils import importutils_ALL_CONTEXTS = weakref.WeakSet() def init_known_contexts(root_helper=None): """Initialise all instantiated PrivContexts. This function should be called at the top of main(), after the command line is parsed and oslo.config is initialised, but before calling any privileged entrypoint, changing user id, forking, or anything else "odd". :param root_helper: List of command and arguments to prefix privsep-helper with, in order to run helper as root. Note, ignored if context's helper_command config option is set. :param fork: Start contexts now using the "fork" method. This assumes the current user already has a superset of the required privileges (eg: current user is root) and effectively ignores root_helper, helper_command, sudo, rootwrap and everything related to the "rootwrap" method. """ if root_helper: for context in _ALL_CONTEXTS: context.helper_command_prefix = root_helper class PrivContext(object): helper_command_prefix = ['sudo'] _ALL_CONTEXTS.add(self) def helper_command(self, sockpath): # We need to be able to reconstruct the context object in the new # python process we'll get after rootwrap/sudo. This means we # need to construct the context object and store it somewhere # globally accessible, and then use that python name to find it # again in the new python interpreter. Yes, it's all a bit # clumsy, and none of it is required when using the fork-based # alternative above. # These asserts here are just attempts to catch errors earlier. # TODO(gus): Consider replacing with setuptools entry_points. assert self.pypath is not None, ( 'helper_command requires priv_context ' 'pypath to be specified') assert importutils.import_class(self.pypath) is self, ( 'helper_command requires priv_context pypath ' 'for context object') # Note order is important here. Deployments will (hopefully) # have the exact arguments in sudoers/rootwrap configs and # reordering args will break configs! if self.conf.helper_command: cmd = shlex.split(self.conf.helper_command) else: cmd = self.helper_command_prefix + ['privsep-helper'] try: for cfg_file in cfg.CONF.config_file: cmd.extend(['--config-file', cfg_file]) except cfg.NoSuchOptError: pass try: if cfg.CONF.config_dir is not None: cmd.extend(['--config-dir', cfg.CONF.config_dir]) except cfg.NoSuchOptError: pass cmd.extend( ['--privsep_context', self.pypath, '--privsep_sock_path', sockpath]) return cmd
deleted_lines: class PrivContext(object):

commit_message:
Added unit test for start container

This patch check two senario
first if  we choose to start a new container
with name say XXX, however in the env a container
already exist with XXX name and second to start a stopped container.

Change-Id: Ibd6c5fbcc6f37ea2481634ac2e6b3edb91ae7aab
Partially-Implements: blueprint ansible-unit-tests

commit_message:
Connect to remote hosts as root

Since this is the user for which we setup the SSH key.

This commit allows to run kolla-ansible as vagrant user without using
sudo.

This only applies to multinode.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ie5231085a66511a520d4dbe5e9f35414acf1900b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/09/331209/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Change-Id: I90bdec6793ac5b2d304e178e5114369b7b3b9626

commit_message:
Only keep localhost for 127.0.0.1

The regex used previously would keep the short hostname (hostname -s)
on the 127.0.0.1 line.

Reset the 127.0.0.1 line to keep only localhost.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I90bdec6793ac5b2d304e178e5114369b7b3b9626
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/08/331208/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sed -i -r "s,^127\.0\.0\.1\s+.*,127\.0\.0\.1 localhost localhost.localdomain localhost4 localhost4.localdomain4," /etc/hosts

Remove unused SUPPORT_NODE variable

The SUPPORT_NODE variable was missed during a refactoring of
bootstrap.sh and is now unused. Remove it.

TrivialFix

commit_message:
Set internal vip to vagrant private network

In vagrant environments, the kolla_internal_vip_address didn't belong
to the private network provisioned on the machine and was failing the
prechecks.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I0e7e4d134e350c49ef7510c7262677754a83bcbf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/06/331206/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set VIP address to be on the vagrant private network sed -i -r "s,^[# ]*kolla_internal_vip_address:.+$,kolla_internal_vip_address: \"172.28.128.254\"," /etc/kolla/globals.yml

commit_message:
Pin test-requirements to match OpenStack requirements

A new release of flake8 is causing lint faiures. Our requirements
should match OpenStack requirements anyway.

This patch pins to the current master requirements from the
OpenStack requirements repository using global-requirements.

Change-Id: I8a4a8ad41af91e12d50343fddf399097f3388155

commit_message:
Remove 413 from image_metadata

There is not any places which raise an HTTPRequestEntityTooLarge
exception on Nova v2.1 API.
Then this patch removes 413 from image_metadata and code from
QuotaError because EC2 code has been removed already.

Change-Id: Ib79056cf65343c21146d77c3d2f829a59f138a7d

commit_message:
Add URIOpt

This change add URIOpt which validates string as URI.

Closes-Bug: #1500398
Change-Id: Ie8736b8654b9feb2a2b174159f08dbea03568d84
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/14/228414/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import validators class URL(ConfigType): """URL type Represents URL. """ BASE_TYPES = six.string_types def __init__(self): super(URL, self).__init__() def __call__(self, value): value = str(value) if not value: raise ValueError("URL cannot be an empty string") if not validators.url(value): raise ValueError("invalid URL") return value def __repr__(self): return "URL" def __eq__(self, other): return self.__class__ == other.__class__

subject: Make wos_used_bytes equals 0 when reports ''
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 22:15:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent/commit/20f248d4d57150aeca811ebc761d607408c7f4db', 'message': "Make wos_used_bytes equals 0 when reports ''

When nothing has been written in vertica, wos_used_bytes
will stay empty and this is causing an issue  when vertica

commit_message:
Make wos_used_bytes equals 0 when reports ''

When nothing has been written in vertica, wos_used_bytes
will stay empty and this is causing an issue  when vertica
plugin tried to convert empty string to an integer.

Change-Id: I604b58c0da1020efa531bf5a4338da144352b08f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/65/331365/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if metric_name == 'wos_used_bytes' and metric_value == '': # when nothing is written, wos_used_bytes is empty. # Needs to convert it to zero. metric_value = 0

The code was a bit messy so simplified it for the following reasons:
* AFTER is always used so no need to have this as parameter
* Although bulk operations are supported by ODL, Neutron notifications
  are sent on a per-resource basis
* Transformation between singular & plural should be done with the
  existing constants (and not simply by appending or removing 's')
* URL translation is only necessary in the V1 driver so moved it there
* Tests were repetitive so extracted common logic

Change-Id: I2542831d205eed3083a8e0da08e57b83a14e74aa

commit_message:
Refactor SG callbacks

The code was a bit messy so simplified it for the following reasons:
* AFTER is always used so no need to have this as parameter
* Although bulk operations are supported by ODL, Neutron notifications
  are sent on a per-resource basis
* Transformation between singular & plural should be done with the
  existing constants (and not simply by appending or removing 's')
* URL translation is only necessary in the V1 driver so moved it there
* Tests were repetitive so extracted common logic
* Generally tried to organize & simplify the code

Change-Id: I2542831d205eed3083a8e0da08e57b83a14e74aa

commit_message:
Show instance lock/unlock actions based on the locked status

The server locked information has been added to nova v2.9.

This patch set is to show/hide the lock/unlock actions using
the locked status from nova.

To get the locked status, the compute version needs to be
2.9 or above, which can be set on local_settings.py.

Change-Id: I947c544b32d6056beae97f1c2aa121dd38fb733b
Closes-bug: #1505845

commit_message:
Pin test-requirements to match OpenStack requirements

A new release of flake8 is causing lint faiures. Our requirements
should match OpenStack requirements anyway.

This patch pins to the current master requirements from the
OpenStack requirements repository using global-requirements.

Change-Id: I5ed6bc3b31d9402272a5b62975b3e14a07a1fab8

commit_message:
Add a hook for test debug

There may be a case when a developer wants to run tests with
debugger specially, when they are broken. This patch will add a
hook in tox so that developers can set break points in their
test can debug them if needed.

Change-Id: Ifa0071f3849d9ac4d2ba7ba3c7ccaf15223a43c4

commit_message:
Make identity v2 user_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes identity v2 user_client use **kwargs.

Also adding some doc link.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I058e74a205ff9223113ad9fed8be61e6b66e7045

added_lines: class _ServiceCommand(command.Command): _action = None # must be set in derived classes parser = super(_ServiceCommand, self).get_parser(prog_name) assert self._action is not None, ( "code error: derived classes must set _action") service.execute_action(parsed_args.service, self._action) class Bootstrap(_ServiceCommand): """Roll out configurations and bootstrap a service.""" _action = 'bootstrap' class Run(_ServiceCommand): _action = 'run' class Kill(_ServiceCommand): _action = 'kill'
deleted_lines: class Bootstrap(command.Command): """Rolling out configurations and bootstrap a service.""" parser = super(Bootstrap, self).get_parser(prog_name) if parsed_args.service == 'all': service.all_services('bootstrap') else: service.bootstrap_service(parsed_args.service) class Run(command.Command): def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(Run, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument('service') return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): if parsed_args.service == 'all': service.all_services('run') else: service.run_service(parsed_args.service) class Kill(command.Command): def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(Kill, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument('service') return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): if parsed_args.service == 'all': service.all_services('kill') else: service.kill_service(parsed_args.service)

Make identity v2 service_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on

All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes identity v2 service_client use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ib5677cc185ace03f2e8824ba84365476823f50d5

commit_message:
Pin test-requirements to match OpenStack requirements

A new release of flake8 is causing lint faiures. Our requirements
should match OpenStack requirements anyway.

This patch pins to the current master requirements from the
OpenStack requirements repository using global-requirements.

Change-Id: Ic536d34a93e0e68bcb929379313baa8c5bac9aca

commit_message:
Pin test-requirements to match OpenStack requirements

A new release of flake8 is causing lint faiures. Our requirements
should match OpenStack requirements anyway.

This patch pins to the current master requirements from the
OpenStack requirements repository using global-requirements.

Change-Id: Ib84c73f13ac917e1b882742b086148ac065c3f95

Add tests for Cinder user messages v3 API

This commit adds basic tests for the list/show/delete
v3 APIs for Cinder's new user messages.

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Andrew Kerr # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_serialization import jsonutils as json from tempest.lib import exceptions as lib_exc from tempest.services.volume.base import base_messages_client API_MICROVERSION_HEADER = 'Openstack-Api-Version' class MessagesClient(base_messages_client.BaseMessagesClient): """Client class to send CRUD Volume V3 API requests""" api_version = 'v3' version_id = 'v3.0' create_resp = 202 def __init__(self, auth_provider, service, region, **kwargs): super(MessagesClient, self).__init__( auth_provider, service, region, **kwargs) self._max_api = None @property def max_api(self): if self._max_api is None: self._max_api = self.discover_max_api() return self._max_api def get_headers(self): headers = super(MessagesClient, self).get_headers() if self.max_api: headers[API_MICROVERSION_HEADER] = 'volume %s' % self.max_api return headers def discover_max_api(self): headers = super(MessagesClient, self).get_headers() url, headers, body = self.auth_provider.auth_request( 'GET', '', headers, None, self.filters) url = url.split(self.api_version)[0] resp, resp_body = self.raw_request(url, 'GET', headers=headers) self.response_checker('GET', resp, resp_body) resp_body = json.loads(resp_body) versions = resp_body['versions'] for version in versions: if version['id'] == self.version_id: return version['version'] raise lib_exc.EndpointNotFound()

commit_message:
XenAPI: Integers returned from XAPI are actually strings

In particular, we were expecting the domid to be an integer
when comparing against -1 in vmops.py to decide if the domain
was shut down.  This test always failed, so domid of -1 was
assumed to be a live domain.

Fix all places where domid is an integer to ensure only string
comparisons are done.
If the domid is '-1' then we raise an exception based on the
instance.  An instance is always passed, so make it clear that
this is non-optional

Change-Id: I8c0d3274fbf68351a1b077e791e50e449ea0af99
Closes-Bug: 1592849

Improve the help text for cells options (8)

- Deprecated note added for cells.driver option.
- Reno added for the deprecated option cells.driver.

Implements blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

commit_message:
Netmask needs corersion to string

Occasionally the netmask value is passed as an int and we need
to force coercion into a string before joining otherwise we get
a TypeError

Original review commit: c06e552fd5a16f3682bac4455f2f75c952cf4eba
Original review Title: Adds ACL, IP Pool, Multipath to Datera Driver

Change-Id: I677d300bc8e99d4f4d70562c6ef46330b575008c

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must

Change-Id: I1e300c5f6ad9f443203504ea9f95e35b49fbde19
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: I1e300c5f6ad9f443203504ea9f95e35b49fbde19

If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>. # # Copyright 2016 Canonical Ltd. # # Authors: # Openstack Charmers < # """ Helpers for high availability. """ import re from charmhelpers.core.hookenv import ( log, relation_set, charm_name, config, status_set, DEBUG, ) from charmhelpers.contrib.openstack.ip import ( resolve_address, ) class DNSHAException(Exception): """Raised when an error occurs setting up DNS HA """ pass def update_dns_ha_resource_params(resources, resource_params, relation_id=None, crm_ocf='ocf:maas:dns'): """ Check for os-*-hostname settings and update resource dictionaries for the HA relation. @param resources: Pointer to dictionary of resources. Usually instantiated in ha_joined(). @param resource_params: Pointer to dictionary of resource parameters. Usually instantiated in ha_joined() @param relation_id: Relation ID of the ha relation @param crm_ocf: Corosync Open Cluster Framework resource agent to use for DNS HA """ settings = ['os-admin-hostname', 'os-internal-hostname', 'os-public-hostname'] # Check which DNS settings are set and update dictionaries hostname_group = [] for setting in settings: hostname = config(setting) if hostname is None: log('DNS HA: Hostname setting {} is None. Ignoring.' ''.format(setting), DEBUG) continue m = re.search('os-(.+?)-hostname', setting) if m: networkspace = m.group(1) else: msg = ('Unexpected DNS hostname setting: {}. ' 'Cannot determine network space name' ''.format(setting)) status_set('blocked', msg) raise DNSHAException(msg) hostname_key = 'res_{}_{}_hostname'.format(charm_name(), networkspace) if hostname_key in hostname_group: log('DNS HA: Resource {}: {} already exists in ' 'hostname group - skipping'.format(hostname_key, hostname), DEBUG) continue hostname_group.append(hostname_key) resources[hostname_key] = crm_ocf resource_params[hostname_key] = ( 'params fqdn="{}" ip_address="{}" ' ''.format(hostname, resolve_address(endpoint_type=networkspace, override=False))) if len(hostname_group) >= 1: log('DNS HA: Hostname group is set with {} as members. ' 'Informing the ha relation'.format(' '.join(hostname_group)), DEBUG) relation_set(relation_id=relation_id, groups={ 'grp_{}_hostnames'.format(charm_name()): ' '.join(hostname_group)}) else: msg = 'DNS HA: Hostname group has no members.' status_set('blocked', msg) raise DNSHAException(msg)

subject: Fix settings for CephFS data and metadata pools
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 18:23:09.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ceph'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/commit/7540a7946a8b113507c589e52b688946271aa9a0', 'message': "Fix settings for CephFS data and metadata pools

Although the devstack ceph plugin uses variables - CEPHFS_DATA_POOL and
CEPHFS_METADATA_POOL - as arguments to the 'osd pool create' commands
that provision the pools required for manila to use the CephFS Native
backend, the overrides to the default values for these variables sets
both of them to $CEPHFS_CEPH_POOL. This setting is counter-intuitive,
and worse, forces use of a single pool for both data and metadata in the
case both default values are overridden.

Use CEPHFS_DATA_POOL and CEPHFS_METADATA_POOL as the override
variables for the data pool and metadata pool, respectively.

Change-Id: Iae2859388ce5e74b6f532cf2cf7809aaa09746cb
Closes-Bug: 1593829
"}]
commit_message:
Fix settings for CephFS data and metadata pools

Although the devstack ceph plugin uses variables - CEPHFS_DATA_POOL and
CEPHFS_METADATA_POOL - as arguments to the 'osd pool create' commands
that provision the pools required for manila to use the CephFS Native
backend, the overrides to the default values for these variables sets
both of them to $CEPHFS_CEPH_POOL. This setting is counter-intuitive,
and worse, forces use of a single pool for both data and metadata in the
case both default values are overridden.

Use CEPHFS_DATA_POOL and CEPHFS_METADATA_POOL as the override
variables for the data pool and metadata pool, respectively.

Change-Id: Iae2859388ce5e74b6f532cf2cf7809aaa09746cb
Closes-Bug: 1593829
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph refs/changes/92/331292/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CEPHFS_METADATA_POOL=${CEPHFS_METADATA_POOL:-cephfs_metadata} CEPHFS_DATA_POOL=${CEPHFS_DATA_POOL:-cephfs_data}
deleted_lines: CEPHFS_METADATA_POOL=${CEPHFS_CEPH_POOL:-cephfs_metadata} CEPHFS_DATA_POOL=${CEPHFS_CEPH_POOL:-cephfs_data}

commit_message:
Fix for multiple status_set() in assess_status()

This fixes a multiple status_set() bug in the implementation of assess_status()
on the charm, when it is determining whether it is active AND clustered.
The change hooks into the _determine_os_workload_status() directly in
charmhelpers to ensure that status_set() is only called once when
assess_status() is called.

Change-Id: Idfd93126c3edb41f83897c82ee7f20fe5f366559
Related-Bug:#1588462
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-rabbitmq-server refs/changes/50/331150/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _determine_os_workload_status, # we're active - so just return the 'active' state, but if 'active' # is returned, then it is ignored by the assess_status system. return 'active', "message is ignored" def _assess_status_func(): state, message = _determine_os_workload_status( configs, {}, charm_func=assess_cluster_status, services=services(), ports=None) if state == 'active' and clustered(): message = 'Unit is ready and clustered' status_set(state, message) return _assess_status_func
deleted_lines: make_assess_status_func, status_get, if clustered(): return 'active', 'Unit is ready and clustered' else: return 'active', 'Unit is ready' # Charm has a bespoke status message when clustered if status_get() == ('active', 'Unit is ready') and clustered(): if clustered(): status_set('active', 'Unit is ready and clustered') return make_assess_status_func( configs, {}, charm_func=assess_cluster_status, services=services(), ports=None)

commit_message:
Add exception/signal handling to HTTP client

This adds HTTP status code checking and requestslib exception handling
to the SynHTTPClient. It also adds the notion of a "signal", which is a
kind of "check" in the HTTP client, such as catching an exception or a
500 HTTP status code.

Change-Id: I2ee8ba0ab264a9c6208f616f2c3ec09d200be0bc

commit_message:
Do not prompt for scope options with default scoped tokens

This changes the scope validation to occur after a token has already
been created.

Previous flow:

1. Validate authentication options.
2. Validate authorization options if the command requires a scope.
3. Create a token (using authentication + authorization options)
4. Run command.

This means that scope was being checked, even if a default scope was
applied in step 3 by Keystone.

New flow:

1. Validate authentication options.
2. Create token (using authentication + authorization options)
3  Validate authorization options if the command requires a scope and
   the token is not scoped.
4. Run command.

Change-Id: Idae368a11249f425b14b891fc68b4176e2b3e981
Closes-Bug: 1592062
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/57/330057/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
lib/neutron-plugins: Pass conf file parameter

The 'neutron_plugin_configure_l3_agent' function expects a path to a
configuration file as a parameter. This was not done for one call,
resulting in the generation of a 'DEFAULT' file in the DevStack
directory along with an invalid L3 configuration file. Resolve this.

Change-Id: I5781cb1ec4cfc1699e61dbc324d0bdb824b56be1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/33/329933/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Increase rgw init timeout to 1200 seconds

This changeset increases the initialization timeout
for rgw instances from 300 -> 1200 seconds.

This change decreases the chance that the rgw instance
will timeout prior to OSD's actually joing the Ceph storage
cluster as usable storage is required for this operation.

Change-Id: I6c5442edc2fb25ff37d7a4bd0bc49aabd6f2d24c
Closes-Bug: 1577519
(cherry picked from commit 3bacc91230dbc00305d0fac677b4022bda58e350)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-radosgw refs/changes/97/331197/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Ceph Radosgw Race

This patch adds some deeper inspection to the ceph-mon
and ceph-radosgw relation.  It will now wait for 3 osds
to be both up and in the cluster before telling the radosgw
that it is allowed to connect.

Change-Id: Ibe5d397859859765a6e1b8694495f62be77111bd
Closes-Bug: 1577519
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-mon refs/changes/74/326674/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import json local_unit, ERROR) # Osds are related but have they actually come up? try: in_osds = osds_in_cluster() up_osds = osds_up_in_cluster() if in_osds >= num_units and up_osds >= num_units: return True else: return False except ValueError: # Unable to query Ceph. Play it safe return Falsedef osds_in_cluster(): """ Query Ceph and return how many osds are marked as IN in the cluster. :return: The number of osds marked in in the cluster. """ # TODO: Refactor to use ceph_api once layers land output = subprocess.check_output(['ceph', '-s', '--format=json']) try: j = json.loads(output) if j['osdmap']['osdmap']['num_in_osds']: return j['osdmap']['osdmap']['num_in_osds'] else: return None except ValueError as err: log("Unable to decode json: {}".format(output), level=ERROR) raise err def osds_up_in_cluster(): """ Query Ceph and return how many osds are marked as UP in the cluster. :return: The number of osds marked up in the cluster. """ # TODO: Refactor to use ceph_api once layers land output = subprocess.check_output(['ceph', '-s', '--format=json']) try: j = json.loads(output) if j['osdmap']['osdmap']['num_up_osds']: return j['osdmap']['osdmap']['num_up_osds'] else: return None except ValueError as err: log("Unable to decode json: {}".format(output), level=ERROR) raise err

commit_message:
Add support for Vagrant deployment

A common pattern is to maintain a Vagrantfile for each role to allow
for convenient testing for the community. This serves as another
step towards making the Gnocchi role ready for OSA integration.

Partial-Blueprint: role-gnocchi
Change-Id: Ib85ed1ab2e95713c4588a7af4418bd7cf61d5b9b

commit_message:
Create trunk on target of LPM

Creates a trunk on the destination of a live migration using a free
vlan. Pairs the source CNA and the new trunk adapter by updating
the CNA to use the newly discovered free vlan.

Change-Id: I13c11cc1b86178ac2e917d280453cc4decc332d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/40/312240/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from pypowervm.wrappers import logical_partition as lpar # Get vlan vswitch_w = CONF.powervm.pvm_vswitch_for_ovs vlan = pvm_cna._find_free_vlan(self.adapter, self.host_uuid, vswitch_w) # Update CNA to use new vlan_id cna = pvm_net.CNA.get( self.adapter, mac=vif['address'], one_result=True) cna.pvid(vlan) # Create a trunk with the vlan_id trunk_adpt = pvm_net.TrunkAdapter.bld( self.adapter, pvid=vlan, vlan_ids=[], vswitch=vswitch_w) trunk_adpt.create(parent_type=lpar.LPAR, parent_uuid=self.host_uuid) # re enable the CNA cna.enabled(True)
deleted_lines: pass

commit_message:
Remove deleted override vars from inventory

When re-running the dynamic_inventory.py script, either directly or via
a playbook run, deployers expect that their edits to
openstack_user_config.yml are reflected in the inventory. However, previous
behavior only added new entries or updated existing variables with new
values; variables that were deleted remained in the inventory JSON
file.

This patch only corrects behavior for the variables includes in the
global_overrides dictionary. Similar behavior may be present in other
aspects of the inventory, such as removing host vars, but those should
be addressed in later patches.

Closes-Bug: #1588902

Change-Id: I86d6627ef34d99c7ef3c77fcd42c918a13f0fe81
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/80/325380/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def restore_config(self): # get back our initial user config file os.remove(USER_CONFIG_FILE) os.rename(USER_CONFIG_FILE + ".tmp", USER_CONFIG_FILE) self.config_changed = False self.restore_config()class TestGlobalOverridesConfigDeletion(TestConfigChecks): def setUp(self): super(TestGlobalOverridesConfigDeletion, self).setUp() def add_global_override(self, var_name, var_value): """Adds an arbitrary name and value to the global_overrides dict.""" overrides = self.user_defined_config['global_overrides'] overrides[var_name] = var_value self.write_config() def test_global_overrides_delete_when_merge(self): self.add_global_override('foo', 'bar') # Generate the initial inventory files initial_inventory = get_inventory(clean=False) self.assertIsNotNone( initial_inventory['all']['vars']['foo']) # Remove the value now by restoring our old config file self.restore_config() second_inventory = get_inventory(clean=True) self.assertIsNone(second_inventory['all']['vars']['foo'], "foo var not removed from group_vars_all")
deleted_lines: # get back our initial user config file os.remove(USER_CONFIG_FILE) os.rename(USER_CONFIG_FILE + ".tmp", USER_CONFIG_FILE)

commit_message:
Pin test-requirements to match OpenStack requirements

A new release of flake8 is causing lint faiures. Our requirements
should match OpenStack requirements anyway.

This patch pins to the current master requirements from the
OpenStack requirements repository using global-requirements.

Change-Id: Iaf5fffa3b3fdd4ec0bc0e8f28bb2e816b67c8729

Config options: centralize driver libvirt options (1)

The config options of the "nova.conf" section "libvirt" got
moved to the new central location "nova/conf/libvirt.py".
Subsequent patches will then another options in libvirt section.
This is the first patch in a long-chain patchs.

Change-Id: I3c66c6e211a35eeefadc07b9dae74764419ee7f4
Co-Authored-by: Markus Zoeller <mzoeller@de.ibm.com>
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

commit_message:
Pin test-requirements to match OpenStack requirements

A new release of flake8 is causing lint faiures. Our requirements
should match OpenStack requirements anyway.

This patch pins to the current master requirements from the
OpenStack requirements repository using global-requirements.

Change-Id: I51e78ce8c537dd2eaa9cd254e8d32530aec7b8d8

url is of the form:

  transport://user:pass@host1:port[,hostN:portN]/virtual_host

commit_message:
Add transport_url parameters for oslo.messaging

This commit adds the transport_url parameters for oslo.messaging. The
url is of the form:

  transport://user:pass@host1:port[,hostN:portN]/virtual_host

Where the transport scheme specifies the rpc or notification backend
as one of rabbit, amqp, zmq, etc. Oslo.messaging is deprecating the
host, port, and auth configuration options [1]. All drivers will get
these options via the transport_url.

This patch:
* use oslo::messaging::default resource
* use oslo::messaging::notifications resource
* add parameters for transport_url(s)
* update spec tests
* add feature release note

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317285/

Change-Id: If5f30ba1944d897d2dd63539f4bb8a80e6c46c5e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-sahara refs/changes/34/322934/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Add oslo.messaging transport_url parameters via puppet-oslo resource

OpenStack requirements repository using global-requirements.

Improve translation properties

Improve translation for list-type properties
in subschemas of list-type properties.

Change-Id: I4d877c146988f54599614d4e69da9330ffa70afd
Closes-bug: #1551859

commit_message:
Support users without projects in keystone library

Update the ensure_user, ensure_user_role, and ensure_group_role commands
and dependent functions to allow creation of and role assignment to a
user without specifying a project.
This will allow use of the keystone library for creating users, such as
the heat stack admin, within only a domain.

Since a role can only get granted to either a project or domain at one
time, only attempt to grant the role within the project if both are
provided.

Notifications of state changes for the ensure role commands have also
been fixed.

Partial-Bug: 1579612
Change-Id: I6a132e5407c9881a047037b85bd6e25b85c0d8a1

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: Ia4cbe14575851c0f54cbb5845ffd6b8669fb7fa2

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: I58a0acf7787e039aeb67f856746130042fc459cf

See the # GNU Lesser General Public License for more details. # # You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License # along with charm-helpers. If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>. # # Copyright 2016 Canonical Ltd. # # Authors: # Openstack Charmers < # """ Helpers for high availability. """ import re from charmhelpers.core.hookenv import ( log, relation_set, charm_name, config, status_set, DEBUG, ) from charmhelpers.contrib.openstack.ip import ( resolve_address, ) class DNSHAException(Exception): """Raised when an error occurs setting up DNS HA """ pass def update_dns_ha_resource_params(resources, resource_params, relation_id=None, crm_ocf='ocf:maas:dns'): """ Check for os-*-hostname settings and update resource dictionaries for the HA relation. @param resources: Pointer to dictionary of resources. Usually instantiated in ha_joined(). @param resource_params: Pointer to dictionary of resource parameters. Usually instantiated in ha_joined() @param relation_id: Relation ID of the ha relation @param crm_ocf: Corosync Open Cluster Framework resource agent to use for DNS HA """ settings = ['os-admin-hostname', 'os-internal-hostname', 'os-public-hostname'] # Check which DNS settings are set and update dictionaries hostname_group = [] for setting in settings: hostname = config(setting) if hostname is None: log('DNS HA: Hostname setting {} is None. Ignoring.' ''.format(setting), DEBUG) continue m = re.search('os-(.+?)-hostname', setting) if m: networkspace = m.group(1) else: msg = ('Unexpected DNS hostname setting: {}. ' 'Cannot determine network space name' ''.format(setting)) status_set('blocked', msg) raise DNSHAException(msg) hostname_key = 'res_{}_{}_hostname'.format(charm_name(), networkspace) if hostname_key in hostname_group: log('DNS HA: Resource {}: {} already exists in ' 'hostname group - skipping'.format(hostname_key, hostname), DEBUG) continue hostname_group.append(hostname_key) resources[hostname_key] = crm_ocf resource_params[hostname_key] = ( 'params fqdn="{}" ip_address="{}" ' ''.format(hostname, resolve_address(endpoint_type=networkspace, override=False))) if len(hostname_group) >= 1: log('DNS HA: Hostname group is set with {} as members. ' 'Informing the ha relation'.format(' '.join(hostname_group)), DEBUG) relation_set(relation_id=relation_id, groups={ 'grp_{}_hostnames'.format(charm_name()): ' '.join(hostname_group)}) else: msg = 'DNS HA: Hostname group has no members.' status_set('blocked', msg) raise DNSHAException(msg)

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: Ic06866dcd9c008726e0062efec3e936c7e4c396b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-heat refs/changes/32/331032/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: def resolve_address(endpoint_type=PUBLIC): resolved_address = _get_address_override(endpoint_type) if resolved_address: return resolved_address

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: I1b601d88e32368b0f0705795ba03272a13816bb2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-openvswitch refs/changes/37/331037/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: def resolve_address(endpoint_type=PUBLIC): resolved_address = _get_address_override(endpoint_type) if resolved_address: return resolved_address

Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: Icc02c2fec60f413e7eba39ee2963cba14cbbfe51

commit_message:
Add auto interval to nodepool dashboard

Give the ability for the user to change the interval range on the
dashboard. Helpful if you want to summarize stats over different time
periods.

Change-Id: I9ccf90df69722ce8a42b7835660dd7c1e4453726
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/81/331281/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: templating: - name: interval options: - text: auto selected: True - text: 1m - text: 10m - text: 30m - text: 1h - text: 6h - text: 12h - text: 1d type: interval - target: aliasByNode(summarize(stats.gauges.nodepool.target.*.nodes.building, $interval), 4) - target: aliasByNode(summarize(stats.gauges.nodepool.manager.*.nodes.ready, $interval), 4) - target: aliasByNode(summarize(stats.gauges.nodepool.manager.*.nodes.used, $interval), 4) - target: aliasByNode(summarize(stats.gauges.nodepool.manager.*.nodes.delete, $interval), 4)
deleted_lines: - target: aliasByNode(stats.gauges.nodepool.target.*.nodes.building, 4) - target: aliasByNode(stats.gauges.nodepool.manager.*.nodes.ready, 4) - target: aliasByNode(stats.gauges.nodepool.manager.*.nodes.used, 4) - target: aliasByNode(stats.gauges.nodepool.manager.*.nodes.delete, 4)

Add `openstack zone transfer accept list` cli to designateclient

This patch add cli for listing accepted zone ownership transfer

and corresponding test cases.

commit_message:
Pin test-requirements to match OpenStack requirements

A new release of flake8 is causing lint faiures. Our requirements
should match OpenStack requirements anyway.

This patch pins to the current master requirements from the
OpenStack requirements repository using global-requirements.

Change-Id: Ic1e35ec0c27b88d0aa8455a48752642db6c3018b

commit_message:
Add API for listing zone transfer accepts

Change-Id: I3dc042f666be43649bb3dec6e92cc67d1c32578f
Implements: blueprint zone-transfer-accept-list
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/20/326420/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def count_zone_transfer_accept(self, context, criterion=None): query = select([func.count(tables.zone_transfer_accepts.c.id)]) query = self._apply_criterion(tables.zone_transfer_accepts, query, criterion) query = self._apply_tenant_criteria(context, tables.zone_transfer_accepts, query) query = self._apply_deleted_criteria(context, tables.zone_transfer_accepts, query) resultproxy = self.session.execute(query) result = resultproxy.fetchone() if result is None: return 0 return result[0] zone_transfer_accept = self._find( context, tables.zone_transfer_accepts, objects.ZoneTransferAccept, objects.ZoneTransferAcceptList, exceptions.ZoneTransferAcceptNotFound, criterion, one, marker, limit, sort_key, sort_dir) if not one: zone_transfer_accept.total_count = self.count_zone_transfer_accept( context, criterion) return zone_transfer_accept
deleted_lines: return self._find( context, tables.zone_transfer_accepts, objects.ZoneTransferAccept, objects.ZoneTransferAcceptList, exceptions.ZoneTransferAcceptNotFound, criterion, one, marker, limit, sort_key, sort_dir)

commit_message:
Enable linters job to use upper-constraints

The 'linters' job currently does not deploy the upper-constraints
file, so it cannot be used by any of the lint jobs it activates.

This patch switches the builder to ensure that upper-constraints
can be used.

Change-Id: Iada3a91ee0885710c0fee5aead689b5cdcea118e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/17/331317/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: - gerrit-git-prep

commit_message:
Add temporary workaround for build failure

Currently builds are failing due to a dependency-of-dependency update
in gulp-header (via gulp-angular-templatecache) that is looking for
a file that doesn't exist. This adds an empty file to satisfy it as a
workaround.

Change-Id: I6849892d8f6d4a397f6fc29975041c6da9fef0f8

commit_message:
Consider pre-existing VMs when testing server list

When running the test_list_servers_by_limits_greater_than_actual_count
test using pre-provisioned accounts, the test gives a false positive
since it does not consider the VMs the user could already have before
the test started.
This commit fixes the test by considering those pre-existing VMs a
user might have.

Change-Id: I5d18cdced9f074d3214f9f0b9515929ba5bf7c04
Closes-Bug: 1592971

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-16 23:11:32.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/extensions/test_dns_integration.py', 'neutron/services/externaldns/drivers/designate/driver.py', 'releasenotes/notes/add-designate-driver-ssl-options-169c299c96f2aff0.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c705e2f9f6c7b4a9db4a80a764268e490ea41f01', 'message': 'Fix designate dns driver for SSL based endpoints

Allow setting options in designate section to specify if want
to skip SSL cert check. This makes it possible to work with HTTPS
based endpoints, the default behavior of keystoneclient is to always
set verify=True however in current code, one cannot either provide
a valid CA cert or skip the verification.

DocImpact: Introduce two additional options for `[designate]` section
in neutron.conf
CONF.designate.insecure to allow insecure connections over SSL.
CONF.designate.ca_cert for a valid cert when connecting over SSL

Change-Id: Ic371cc11d783618c38ee40a18206b0c2a197bb3e
Closes-Bug: #1588067
'}]
commit_message:
Fix designate dns driver for SSL based endpoints

Allow setting options in designate section to specify if want
to skip SSL cert check. This makes it possible to work with HTTPS
based endpoints, the default behavior of keystoneclient is to always
set verify=True however in current code, one cannot either provide
a valid CA cert or skip the verification.

DocImpact: Introduce two additional options for `[designate]` section
in neutron.conf
CONF.designate.insecure to allow insecure connections over SSL.
CONF.designate.ca_cert for a valid cert when connecting over SSL

Change-Id: Ic371cc11d783618c38ee40a18206b0c2a197bb3e
Closes-Bug: #1588067
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/17/330817/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: > Add options to designate external dns driver of neutron for SSL based connections. This makes it possible to use neutron with designate in scenario where endpoints are SSL based. Users can specify to skip cert validation or specify path to a valid cert in [designate] section of neutron.conf file. features: - Two new options are added to `[designate]` section to support SSL. - First option `insecure` allows to skip SSL validation when creating a keystone session to initate a designate client. Default value is False, which means to always verify connection. - Second option `ca_cert` allows setting path to a valid cert file. Default is None.

commit_message:
Change port used for Ironic static http to 3928

Due to recent infrastructure changes, infra began using port 8088. This
caused a conflict with our apache config, causing services to not start.
Infra is changing this port (Ie67bbba02dbf61a481f66001de3e0dede9448316)
but it may take up to a week to take effect.

Instead of having our gate broken for a week, I'm changing the default
port. 3928 was not chosen at random; it's listed as the netboot-pxe
service port in /etc/services.

Change-Id: Ifdcf3c82fd9ee64c1548e47dba4c78c2347959e0
Co-Authored-By: John L. Villalovos <john.l.villalovos@intel.com>
Closes-bug: 1590139
(cherry picked from commit 2898b622f7072995b0c778d2a762adba5afe75aa)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/39/330839/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: IRONIC_HTTP_PORT=${IRONIC_HTTP_PORT:-3928}
deleted_lines: IRONIC_HTTP_PORT=${IRONIC_HTTP_PORT:-8088}

commit_message:
Pin test-requirements to match OpenStack requirements

A new release of flake8 is causing lint faiures. Our requirements
should match OpenStack requirements anyway.

This patch pins to the current master requirements from the
OpenStack requirements repository using global-requirements.

Change-Id: I1f8bc6c83495789faf74382fa901915de54114d5

commit_message:
Refactor test_shell

This file has become difficult to maintain with conditionals
everywhere to handle the different http clients.

This change replaces the http mocking code with calls to a handful of
mock methods, and deletes what is left unused.

Change-Id: Id2339b63a90f4805afe94f89f4c2715834588c61
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/75/327975/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: from heatclient.common import http from heatclient import exc def script_heat_list(url=None, show_nested=False, client=http.HTTPClient): if url is None: url = '/stacks?' resp_dict = {"stacks": [ { "id": "1", "stack_name": "teststack", "stack_owner": "testowner", "project": "testproject", "stack_status": 'CREATE_COMPLETE', "creation_time": "2012-10-25T01:58:47Z" }, { "id": "2", "stack_name": "teststack2", "stack_owner": "testowner", "project": "testproject", "stack_status": 'IN_PROGRESS', "creation_time": "2012-10-25T01:58:47Z" }] } if show_nested: nested = { "id": "3", "stack_name": "teststack_nested", "stack_status": 'IN_PROGRESS', "creation_time": "2012-10-25T01:58:47Z", "parent": "theparentof3" } resp_dict["stacks"].append(nested) resp = FakeHTTPResponse(200, 'success, you', {'content-type': 'application/json'}, jsonutils.dumps(resp_dict)) if client == http.SessionClient: client.request(url, 'GET').AndReturn(resp) else: client.json_request('GET', url).AndReturn((resp, resp_dict)) def mock_script_heat_list(show_nested=False): resp_dict = {"stacks": [ { "id": "1", "stack_name": "teststack", "stack_owner": "testowner", "project": "testproject", "stack_status": 'CREATE_COMPLETE', "creation_time": "2012-10-25T01:58:47Z" }, { "id": "2", "stack_name": "teststack2", "stack_owner": "testowner", "project": "testproject", "stack_status": 'IN_PROGRESS', "creation_time": "2012-10-25T01:58:47Z" }] } if show_nested: nested = { "id": "3", "stack_name": "teststack_nested", "stack_status": 'IN_PROGRESS', "creation_time": "2012-10-25T01:58:47Z", "parent": "theparentof3" } resp_dict["stacks"].append(nested) resp = FakeHTTPResponse(200, 'success, you', {'content-type': 'application/json'}, jsonutils.dumps(resp_dict)) return resp, resp_dict def mock_script_event_list( stack_name="teststack", resource_name=None, rsrc_eventid1="7fecaeed-d237-4559-93a5-92d5d9111205", rsrc_eventid2="e953547a-18f8-40a7-8e63-4ec4f509648b", action="CREATE", final_state="COMPLETE", fakehttp=True): resp_dict = {"events": [ {"event_time": "2013-12-05T14:14:31", "id": rsrc_eventid1, "links": [{"href": "http://heat.example.com:8004/foo", "rel": "self"}, {"href": "http://heat.example.com:8004/foo2", "rel": "resource"}, {"href": "http://heat.example.com:8004/foo3", "rel": "stack"}], "logical_resource_id": "myDeployment", "physical_resource_id": None, "resource_name": resource_name if resource_name else "testresource", "resource_status": "%s_IN_PROGRESS" % action, "resource_status_reason": "state changed"}, {"event_time": "2013-12-05T14:14:32", "id": rsrc_eventid2, "links": [{"href": "http://heat.example.com:8004/foo", "rel": "self"}, {"href": "http://heat.example.com:8004/foo2", "rel": "resource"}, {"href": "http://heat.example.com:8004/foo3", "rel": "stack"}], "logical_resource_id": "myDeployment", "physical_resource_id": "bce15ec4-8919-4a02-8a90-680960fb3731", "resource_name": resource_name if resource_name else "testresource", "resource_status": "%s_%s" % (action, final_state), "resource_status_reason": "state changed"}]} if resource_name is None: # if resource_name is not specified, # then request is made for stack events. Hence include the stack event stack_event1 = "0159dccd-65e1-46e8-a094-697d20b009e5" stack_event2 = "8f591a36-7190-4adb-80da-00191fe22388" resp_dict["events"].insert( 0, {"event_time": "2013-12-05T14:14:30", "id": stack_event1, "links": [{"href": "http://heat.example.com:8004/foo", "rel": "self"}, {"href": "http://heat.example.com:8004/foo2", "rel": "resource"}, {"href": "http://heat.example.com:8004/foo3", "rel": "stack"}], "logical_resource_id": "aResource", "physical_resource_id": None, "resource_name": stack_name, "resource_status": "%s_IN_PROGRESS" % action, "resource_status_reason": "state changed"}) resp_dict["events"].append( {"event_time": "2013-12-05T14:14:33", "id": stack_event2, "links": [{"href": "http://heat.example.com:8004/foo", "rel": "self"}, {"href": "http://heat.example.com:8004/foo2", "rel": "resource"}, {"href": "http://heat.example.com:8004/foo3", "rel": "stack"}], "logical_resource_id": "aResource", "physical_resource_id": None, "resource_name": stack_name, "resource_status": "%s_%s" % (action, final_state), "resource_status_reason": "state changed"}) resp = FakeHTTPResponse( 200, 'OK', {'content-type': 'application/json'}, jsonutils.dumps(resp_dict)) if fakehttp else None return resp, resp_dict def script_heat_normal_error(client=http.HTTPClient): resp_dict = { "explanation": "The resource could not be found.", "code": 404, "error": { "message": "The Stack (bad) could not be found.", "type": "StackNotFound", "traceback": "", }, "title": "Not Found" } resp = FakeHTTPResponse(400, 'The resource could not be found', {'content-type': 'application/json'}, jsonutils.dumps(resp_dict)) if client == http.SessionClient: client.request('/stacks/bad', 'GET').AndRaise(exc.from_response(resp)) else: client.json_request('GET', '/stacks/bad').AndRaise(exc.from_response(resp)) def script_heat_error(resp_string, client=http.HTTPClient): resp = FakeHTTPResponse(400, 'The resource could not be found', {'content-type': 'application/json'}, resp_string) if client == http.SessionClient: client.request('/stacks/bad', 'GET').AndRaise(exc.from_response(resp)) else: client.json_request('GET', '/stacks/bad').AndRaise(exc.from_response(resp)) def fake_headers(): return {'X-Auth-Token': 'abcd1234', 'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json', 'User-Agent': 'python-heatclient'} class FakeServiceCatalog(object): def url_for(self, endpoint_type, service_type): return 'http://192.168.1.5:8004/v1/f14b41234' class FakeKeystone(object): service_catalog = FakeServiceCatalog() def __init__(self, auth_token): self.auth_token = auth_token

commit_message:
Install pkg-config package

pkg-config is required to build a wheel for libvirt-python. In the
trusty gate tests it's a dependency of another installed package, in
xenial it's only suggested.

Add pkg-config to repo_build_apt_packages to ensure that it's installed.

Change-Id: Ib86cbd38287fdad539ef6451cd5662422b9abf7b

commit_message:
Remove extra gather_facts setting from playbooks

The lxc-containers playbooks had gather_facts specified twice, and
ansible was always using the latter defintion.

This removes the duplicate entry so that deployer variable settings are
honored.

Change-Id: I9d921c252acc4bc0790a42cbefe725d579c0cbeb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/93/331293/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Pin test-requirements to match OpenStack requirements

A new release of flake8 is causing lint faiures. Our requirements
should match OpenStack requirements anyway.

This patch pins to the current master requirements from the
OpenStack requirements repository using global-requirements.

Change-Id: I928c8fecfe17029ba7b60135fa2c2d94db447099

Pin test-requirements to match OpenStack requirements

A new release of flake8 is causing lint faiures. Our requirements
should match OpenStack requirements anyway.

This patch pins to the current master requirements from the
OpenStack requirements repository using global-requirements.

commit_message:
Refer to operator VM as primary VM

This allows us to execute vagrant commands by default on the 'operator'
VM and eliminate one of the difference between AIO and multinode.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ia14aa026d1146ec4b1e006c72a2460edfc0cf6eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/05/331205/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: config.vm.define "operator" do |admin|

Update downloaded images to latest delorean repos

- added developer mode
- added playbook to update qcow2 images to latest delorean repos

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/98/327898/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This role wraps existing functions in tripleo-ci # codebase for overcloud images manipulation - name: get all qcow2 images find: path: "{{ working_dir }}" patterns: "*.qcow2" register: qcow_images - debug: var=qcow_images - name: generate update script template: src: update_image.sh.j2 dest: "{{ working_dir}}/update_image.sh" - name: run update script on image command: > virt-customize -v -a {{ item.path }} --run update_image.sh args: chdir: "{{ working_dir }}" environment: LIBGUESTFS_BACKEND: direct LIBVIRT_DEFAULT_URI: "{{ libvirt_uri }}" with_items: "{{ qcow_images.files }}"

commit_message:
Add IPv6 rule creation to validation resources

This commit adds a stage for creating ipv6 security group rules if
ip_version_for_ssh is set to 6. Previously, we would only create the
ipv4 rules even if we knew that ipv6 was going to be used for ssh.

Co-Authored-By: Chris Lee <chris.lee@dreamhost.com>
Change-Id: I1a27babf772481f4651c55d9cd2e3c9efa12da32
Closes-Bug: #1593416
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/90/330790/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _create_ipv6_sec_groups(os, add_rule=False): sec_groups_client = os.security_groups_client sec_group_rules_client = os.security_rules_client sg_name = data_utils.rand_name('securitygroup-') sec_group = sec_groups_client.create_security_group( name=sg_name)['security_group'] if add_rule: for direction in ['ingress', 'egress']: sec_group_rules_client.create_security_group_rule( security_group_ip=sec_group['id'], protocol='tcp', port_range_min=22, port_range_max=22, ethertype='IPv6', direction=direction) sec_group_rules_client.create_security_group_rule( security_group_ip=sec_group['id'], protocol='icmp', ethertype='IPv6', direction=direction) LOG.debug("SSH Validation resource security group with tcp ssh and icmp " "rules %s created for IPv6" % sg_name) def create_ssh_security_group(os, add_rule=False): if CONF.ip_version_for_ssh == 6 and CONF.service_available.neutron: _create_ipv6_sec_groups(os, add_rule=add_rule)
deleted_lines: def create_ssh_security_group(os, add_rule=False):

added_lines: ## Enable Developer mode If you are working on TripleO upstream development, and need to reproduce what runs in tripleo-ci, you will want to use developer mode. This will fetch the images produced by tripleo-ci instead of the ones produced by RDO. The incanation for a job using the quickstart defaults other than developer mode would be: bash quickstart.sh \ --extra-vars devmode=true \ --extra-vars @config/general_config/tripleo-ci-cached.yml \ $VIRTHOST master-tripleo

commit_message:
Replace locks in volume manager

Use Tooz locks from coordination module in volume manager.

Partially implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Co-Authored-By: Szymon Borkowski <szymon.borkowski@intel.com>
Change-Id: I25b088a6a7c5d89dd64b5365c0441cf8e94f33fe

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: I90519337e83447c1824e26bbd3b3c29115feef75

deleted_lines: def resolve_address(endpoint_type=PUBLIC): resolved_address = _get_address_override(endpoint_type) if resolved_address: return resolved_address

commit_message:
Add copy-ansible to console-log publisher

This is our first attempt to enable zuul-launcher to publish our
ansible playbooks to static.o.o. I've confirmed JJB will not covert
this in to jenkins XML.

Change-Id: I271d551cfa2043127022cc80fe405b2c623981aa
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Change port used for Ironic static http to 3928
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 00:37:55.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/2898b622f7072995b0c778d2a762adba5afe75aa', 'message': "Change port used for Ironic static http to 3928

Due to recent infrastructure changes, infra began using port 8088. This

Infra is changing this port (Ie67bbba02dbf61a481f66001de3e0dede9448316)
but it may take up to a week to take effect.

Instead of having our gate broken for a week, I'm changing the default
port. 3928 was not chosen at random; it's listed as the netboot-pxe

Change-Id: Ifdcf3c82fd9ee64c1548e47dba4c78c2347959e0
Closes-bug: 1590139
"}]
commit_message:
Change port used for Ironic static http to 3928

Due to recent infrastructure changes, infra began using port 8088. This
caused a conflict with our apache config, causing services to not start.
Infra is changing this port (Ie67bbba02dbf61a481f66001de3e0dede9448316)
but it may take up to a week to take effect.

Instead of having our gate broken for a week, I'm changing the default
port. 3928 was not chosen at random; it's listed as the netboot-pxe
service port in /etc/services.

Change-Id: Ifdcf3c82fd9ee64c1548e47dba4c78c2347959e0
Closes-bug: 1590139
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/32/330832/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: IRONIC_HTTP_PORT=${IRONIC_HTTP_PORT:-3928}
deleted_lines: IRONIC_HTTP_PORT=${IRONIC_HTTP_PORT:-8088}

commit_message:
Change dependency to use flavors

This makes sure we install the correct and only the correct dependencies
when installing tooz, based on the driver one wants to use.

Change-Id: I58825cf228771a00b28d515a552141b42f884efa

commit_message:
Enable no-use-before-define

This patch enables the "no-use-before-define" eslint rule from
eslint-config-openstack, and corrects any linting errors found.

http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-use-before-define

Change-Id: I18d5561e4e2e5df1fc155c9d26fbaaca7c48827d

commit_message:
Enable block-scoped-var

This rule enables the "block-scoped-var" eslint rule from
eslint-config-openstack. This patch revealed a scope initialization
conflict in the pie-chart directive, which has been corrected.

http://eslint.org/docs/rules/block-scoped-var

Change-Id: Ia7c2dbe3aa3968755130ffa8f11b4a1a7f4f16ef

commit_message:
Enable callback-return

This rule enables the "callback-return" eslint rule from
eslint-config-openstack, and corrects any linting errors found.

http://eslint.org/docs/rules/callback-return

Change-Id: I828f14a378042e66894c0b77b55f55f7158974e0

commit_message:
Move pep8 requirements in their own target

There's no need to depends on all the stack, as hacking is pulling
everything. We also can only install hacking in the pep8 target, as it's
not used per say for tests in tooz.

Change-Id: I69426ab2373ba2f76b098cf9e9eb812c8124748f

commit_message:
Wrong parameter in InvalidName exception message

Should pass 'name' to InvalidName exception message
instead of 'uuid', see[1].

[1]https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/stable/mitaka/magnum/api/controllers/v1/types.py#L51

Change-Id: Iaeeafa4aadc1c38b889906f37010574b011c0483
Closes-Bug: #1593679

added_lines: message = _("Expected a name but received %(name)s.")
deleted_lines: message = _("Expected a name but received %(uuid)s.")

commit_message:
Add migration to make service type unique

Previously, mutliple services could be of the same type.
But, service name shouldn't be required since service type is already
a required attribute of service and should be unique.
So, this patch makes service type unique.

Change-Id: I772e13a2310496b8fc426bd26a07f3e58e8cd2d5
Closes-Bug: #1259425
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/93/307593/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_migration_102(self): """Migration 102 should make the service 'type' column unique.""" self.upgrade(101) session = self.sessionmaker() def add_service(service_type): service_id = uuid.uuid4().hex service = { 'id': service_id, 'type': service_type, 'enabled': True } self.insert_dict(session, 'service', service) return service_id first_service_id = add_service('compute') second_service_id = add_service('volume') self.upgrade(102) self.metadata.clear() service_table = sqlalchemy.Table('service', self.metadata, autoload=True) def get_service(service_id): cols = [service_table.c.id, service_table.c.type] f = service_table.c.id == service_id s = sqlalchemy.select(cols).where(f) ep = session.execute(s).fetchone() return ep get_first_service = get_service(first_service_id) get_second_service = get_service(second_service_id) self.assertEqual(first_service_id, get_first_service.id) self.assertEqual("compute", get_first_service.type) self.assertEqual(second_service_id, get_second_service.id) self.assertEqual("volume", get_second_service.type) def test_migration_102_after_upgrade_type_is_unique(self): """Check service 'type' column should be unique after upgrade.""" self.upgrade(101) session = self.sessionmaker() def add_service(service_type): service_id = uuid.uuid4().hex service = { 'id': service_id, 'type': service_type, 'enabled': True } self.insert_dict(session, 'service', service) self.upgrade(102) add_service('compute') self.assertRaises((sqlalchemy.exc.IntegrityError, db_exception.DBError), add_service, 'compute')

commit_message:
Remove node-devstack from nodepool

Here we fully remove node-devstack from nodepool.  I've changed
refrences to it to be cache-devstack as that is the only function the
now defunct node-devstack element was providing.  I did not do this to
openstack-repos as it has already moved to the prepare-node element.

Change-Id: I1dacd9e1af5ebb6056998f6f2705317eddc87714
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>

commit_message:
Auto generate Bay/BayModel name

Add a feature to Magnum to auto-generate human readable names,
like Docker does for un-named containers. Use this feature if
no name is specified upon the creation of a Bay/Baymodel.

Change-Id: I290fb4ad0692c63e6e40af3ec705f205c5ec66d3
Partially-Implements: blueprint auto-generate-name

commit_message:
Drop neutron/i18n.py in favor of neutron/_i18n.py

The hacking rule already ensures everyone uses neutron._i18n.
Now we can drop neutron.i18n.

Closes-Bug: #1520094
Change-Id: I1a415c23fd1db103742e8f3a92a3dd26c7252233

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: Ia3b04c0ea4576ef50e3bc88de366738ba645a0ff

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: Ib0c1da50750027f343bd3b77dcd6b85a059435dd

commit_message:
remove ability to create barbicanclient

keymanager is implemeted using castellan library.
moreover, barbicanclient client was removed from requirements
of sahara at [0], so it's safe to remove that from our code

also removing session for admin method since it's no longer
needed.

[0] I8cb08a365c6175744970b1037501792fe1ddb0c7
Closes-bug: 1593668

Change-Id: I434c0dbc8810a06fb4b9686ffe556c3724f9efff

commit_message:
Fix tempest jobs failing because of extra arguement

Change [1] added extra parameter
that is passed to gate hooks. As [2] that fixes this failure
introduces refactoring that is not relevant for stable/liberty
branch, it is easier just to make a straightforward fix rather than
backport it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/322811/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320998/

Change-Id: Iacf414151de1df5fd890dc5dbb157eff93b5af3f
Closes-Bug: #1592564

commit_message:
Pin test-requirements to match OpenStack requirements

A new release of flake8 is causing lint faiures. Our requirements
should match OpenStack requirements anyway.

This patch pins to the current master requirements from the
OpenStack requirements repository using global-requirements.

Change-Id: Ic62fa455cc32b13765f8fadf0fa260773741f0d3

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: Ie9b1f1a3a52dacdf258863d505e9f3b00b093eec

deleted_lines: def resolve_address(endpoint_type=PUBLIC): resolved_address = _get_address_override(endpoint_type) if resolved_address: return resolved_address

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the

charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

commit_message:
Replace tempest_lib with tempest.lib

As the tempest_lib is deprecated and the code has been moved into
tempest. We should use tempest.lib instead of tempest_lib.

Related-Bug: #1589713

Change-Id: I141455236fccfc5deed4b39151a8581cbaa76f0e

commit_message:
Cleanup volume_type_projects

Currently we are not able to delete volume_type_projects after
deleting volume_types and it persists in the database forever.
Deleted volume_type_projects while deleting volume_types to
cleanup all the associated volume_type_projects records.

This commit uses project_id from cinder/tests/unit/fake_constants.py
so I have also updated the existing hard coded project_id to use it
from fake_constants to maintain the consistency in the module.

Closes-Bug: 1589809
Change-Id: I457215e328e7315cb95df7f928beb92910b58255

commit_message:
Update manage_existing to use volume object

The following patch updates manage_existing APIs to use volume versioned
objects. Changes were made to be backward compatible with older RPC
clients. Changes in the drivers are left to each driver maintainer to
update.

Note that this patch DOES NOT try to use object dot notation everywhere
to keep the size small. This cleanup will be done in the future.

Change-Id: Ie806336ad95834b091c5942d7dfa13345006c1c8
Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-objects

commit_message:
Change flavor show command

Command usage as follow:
usage: nova flavor-show <flavor>
Show details about the given flavor.
Positional arguments:
  <flavor>  Name or ID of flavor

commit_message:
Deleting volume metadata keys with a single request

Deleting multiple volume metadata keys with a single request
to improve performance.

Related blueprint: delete-multiple-metadata-keys

Change-Id: Iddff8ff3ee4d8690f6ec9d3f45181f1f6e7c1ff1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/02/279202/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================== Delete multiple volume metadata keys ==================================== Launchpad Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/delete-multiple-metadata-keys Problem description ==================== The current implementation of Cinder Volume functionality supports deleting of multiple volume metadata as multiple requests for deleting only one metadata key with a request. The more keys are necessary to remove, the more DB queries are needed. It would be more efficient to delete multiple metadata keys with a single request at a time. Use Cases ========= Proposed change ================ * Add support list of metadata keys to remove in delete_metadata in cinderclient/v2/volumes.py * Add support comma-separated list of keys to remove to DELETE request. * Add support list of keys in the volume_metadata_delete in api of sqlachemy. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- The v2 DELETE APIs will support volume metadata comma-separated list of keys to delete: * DELETE /v2/{tenant_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/metadata/key1,key2,key3 Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ The deleting of a volume metadata keys with a single request allows to improve performance by reducing DB calls. It's very important in case with many keys. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Yuriy Nesenenko(ynesenenko@mirantis.com) Work Items ---------- * Add support list of metadata keys to remove in delete_metadata in cinderclient/v2/volumes.py * Add support comma-separated list of keys to remove to DELETE request. * Add support list of keys in the volume_metadata_delete in api of sqlachemy. * Add unit tests. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit tests are needed to ensure response is working correctly. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

commit_message:
Fix bug with detailed error on job binary creation

When a job binary with an invalid name is created (for example
too long) Sahara returns an well-defined exception, but Horizon
just says:
Error: Unable to create job binary
I fix this bug.

Change-Id: I2b7ef115454d8965fcd8971a20102681eb1245b0
Partial-bug: 1427277

commit_message:
Fix exception propagation

Make exception propagation from subprocesses and
threads work correctly.
Make exceptions propagate to top level program.
Make exceptions in subprocesses and threads log correctly.
Fix Tempest README.rst

Change-Id: If9ebe36afdc02c2460a86da7b4d9fa15e12c5824
Closes-Bug: #1592589
