added_lines: import sys def restore_level(self, restore_path, read_pipe, backup, except_queue): try: metadata = backup.metadata() if not self.encrypt_pass_file and metadata.get("encryption", False): raise Exception("Cannot restore encrypted backup without key") tar_command = tar_builders.TarCommandRestoreBuilder( restore_path, metadata.get('compression', self.compression_algo), self.is_windows) if self.encrypt_pass_file: tar_command.set_encryption(self.encrypt_pass_file) if self.dry_run: tar_command.set_dry_run() command = tar_command.build() if winutils.is_windows(): # on windows, chdir to restore path. os.chdir(restore_path) tar_process = subprocess.Popen( command, stdin=subprocess.PIPE, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, shell=True) # Start loop reading the pipe and pass the data to the tar std input. # If EOFError exception is raised, the loop end the std err will be # checked for errors. try: while True: tar_process.stdin.write(read_pipe.recv_bytes()) except EOFError: logging.info('[*] Pipe closed as EOF reached. ' 'Data transmitted successfully') self.check_process_output(tar_process) except Exception as e: except_queue.put(e)
deleted_lines: def restore_level(self, restore_path, read_pipe, backup): metadata = backup.metadata() if not self.encrypt_pass_file and metadata.get("encryption", False): raise Exception("Cannot restore encrypted backup without key") tar_command = tar_builders.TarCommandRestoreBuilder( restore_path, metadata.get('compression', self.compression_algo), self.is_windows) if self.encrypt_pass_file: tar_command.set_encryption(self.encrypt_pass_file) if self.dry_run: tar_command.set_dry_run() command = tar_command.build() if winutils.is_windows(): # on windows, chdir to restore path. os.chdir(restore_path) tar_process = subprocess.Popen( command, stdin=subprocess.PIPE, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, shell=True) # Start loop reading the pipe and pass the data to the tar std input. # If EOFError exception is raised, the loop end the std err will be # checked for errors. try: while True: tar_process.stdin.write(read_pipe.recv_bytes()) except EOFError: logging.info('[*] Pipe closed as EOF reached. ' 'Data transmitted successfully') self.check_process_output(tar_process)

commit_message:
QoS DSCP fullstack tests

This patch introduces fullstack testing for the QoS/DSCP
Open vSwitch implementation. It depends on the python-neutronclient
patches, therefore it could not be merged in the main patch.

Co-Authored-By: Miguel Angel Ajo <majopela@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0ab6a1a0d1430c5791fea1d5b54106c6cc93b937
Closes-Bug: #1468353
Depends-On: I25ad60c1b9a66e568276a772b8c496987d9f8299
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/92/288392/21 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import functoolsDSCP_MARK = 16 def _wait_for_bw_rule_applied_ovs_agent(vm, limit, burst):def _wait_for_bw_rule_applied_linuxbridge_agent(vm, limit, burst):def _wait_for_bw_rule_applied(vm, limit, burst): if isinstance(vm.bridge, ovs_lib.OVSBridge): _wait_for_bw_rule_applied_ovs_agent(vm, limit, burst) if isinstance(vm.bridge, bridge_lib.BridgeDevice): _wait_for_bw_rule_applied_linuxbridge_agent(vm, limit, burst) def _wait_for_bw_rule_removed(vm): _wait_for_bw_rule_applied(vm, None, None) # TODO(njohnston): Bifurcate this into a DSCP class as well # as a bandwidth-limiting class. class TestQoSWithOvsAgent(base.BaseFullStackTestCase): l2_agent_type=constants.AGENT_TYPE_OVS)] super(TestQoSWithOvsAgent, self).setUp(env) self.tenant_id = uuidutils.generate_uuid() self.network = self.safe_client.create_network(self.tenant_id, 'network-test') self.subnet = self.safe_client.create_subnet( self.tenant_id, self.network['id'], cidr='10.0.0.0/24', gateway_ip='10.0.0.1', name='subnet-test', enable_dhcp=False) def _bw_limit_rule_adder(self, limit, burst): def _add_bw_limit_rule(limit, burst, qos_policy): qos_policy_id = qos_policy['id'] rule = self.safe_client.create_bandwidth_limit_rule( self.tenant_id, qos_policy_id, limit, burst) # Make it consistent with GET reply rule['type'] = qos_consts.RULE_TYPE_BANDWIDTH_LIMIT rule['qos_policy_id'] = qos_policy_id qos_policy['rules'].append(rule) return functools.partial(_add_bw_limit_rule, limit, burst) def _dscp_rule_adder(self, dscp_mark): def _add_dscp_rule(dscp_mark, qos_policy): qos_policy_id = qos_policy['id'] rule = self.safe_client.create_dscp_marking_rule( self.tenant_id, qos_policy_id, dscp_mark) # Make it consistent with GET reply rule['type'] = qos_consts.RULE_TYPE_DSCP_MARK rule['qos_policy_id'] = qos_policy_id qos_policy['rules'].append(rule) return functools.partial(_add_dscp_rule, dscp_mark) def _prepare_vm_with_qos_policy(self, rule_add_functions): for rule_add in rule_add_functions: rule_add(qos_policy) vm, qos_policy = self._prepare_vm_with_qos_policy( [self._bw_limit_rule_adder(BANDWIDTH_LIMIT, BANDWIDTH_BURST), self._dscp_rule_adder(DSCP_MARK)]) bw_rule, dscp_rule = qos_policy['rules'] _wait_for_bw_rule_applied(vm, BANDWIDTH_LIMIT, BANDWIDTH_BURST) qos_policy_id = qos_policy['id'] #TODO(njohnston): check DSCP rule applied #_wait_for_dscp_rule_applied(vm, DSCP_MARK) self.client.delete_bandwidth_limit_rule(bw_rule['id'], qos_policy_id) _wait_for_bw_rule_removed(vm) self.client.delete_dscp_marking_rule(dscp_rule['id'], qos_policy_id) #TODO(njohnston): check DSCP removed #_wait_for_dscp_rule_removed(vm) _wait_for_bw_rule_applied(vm, new_limit, new_burst) #TODO(njohnston): same thing for DSCP _wait_for_bw_rule_applied(vm, BANDWIDTH_LIMIT, BANDWIDTH_BURST) _wait_for_bw_rule_removed(vm) #TODO(njohnston): same thing for DSCP

commit_message:
Temporarily remove duplicate block_device_allocate_* nova parameters

Upstream puppet-nova patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/290496/
affects Fuel, so we need to delete duplicate parameters to unlock
upstream change.

Change-Id: Ia6a24808784df859bc975bff70570ae8103e7eb7
Related-Bug: #1555572
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/09/327209/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Switch consistent-return rule to warning mode

eslint-config-openstack has this rule enabled, but in fuel-ui
it was disabled due to large number of violations. We need to
have as little overrides as possible. Also, this rule would help
us with new behaviour of jQuery v3 promises.

Change-Id: Iaeca17feb88bbd6ca51cd1e4727609a6298e5acf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ui refs/changes/14/331114/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: consistent-return: 1 # we have lots of incosistent returns which need to be fixed
deleted_lines: consistent-return: 0 # we have lots of incosistent returns which aren't errors

commit_message:
Add a machine_readable attribute to base.Formatter class

This will be used in command classes descended from Display so
commands can decide to re-format Python data strictures in returned
values.

Change-Id: I194e5b1af5996b103b0283ff34a48c4454540af6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cliff refs/changes/36/287536/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # machine_readable represents if this formatter is intended to be # machine-readable or not. Non-machine-readable formats may (will) # have data fields re-formatted to be easier to read. Default to # True since at this time only the 'table' formatter is not intended # to be parsed in one way or another. # NOTE(dtroyer): This is expected to be used in Command class # descendants to determine if data values (e.g., lists # or dicts) should be reformatted away from their native # Python representations. machine_readable = True

commit_message:
Migrating to layered charm

This is the built version simply because we do not have the
CI infrastructure up to handle layered charms yet, once we do
we can migrate this to the actual layers, currently hosted under
[github/chrismacnaughton](https://github.com/search?q=user%3AChrisMacNaughton+juju)

Change-Id: Iddc085415306a8127408c7c8f435ad1e84f0bd4c

commit_message:
Neutron: remove Q_ML2_PLUGIN_TYPE_DRIVERS

This option basically mimics the defaults, so rather than updating it
everytime the default in Neutron changes[1], and having to update
DevStack[2], let's just rely on the default.

If someone wants a different setting, they should place it in their
local.conf or have a DevStack plugin that configures what they need.

[1]: I8c29a1c1a7c79e02c26ac9e2ad2645d30dfbeefc
[2]: Id75651dfe57a07045a6932a0369668f33c7eef09
Change-Id: I7c10dfbc04cb11cb7792860bae13cd050d189f58

commit_message:
Revert "Remove PyMI"

This reverts commit 207d038866f3755a22d1862f32aa2e739e96d1fd.

The removal was done on the base that this is "not used by
any projects managed by requirements."

PyMI is used by os-win, see also
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/330180/ for details.

os-win is part of requirements, see requirements/projects.txt

Change-Id: I188e4b927afb35756b3e0ee596792e674a3baf35

commit_message:
Increase rgw init timeout to 1200 seconds

This changeset increases the initialization timeout
for rgw instances from 300 -> 1200 seconds.

This change decreases the chance that the rgw instance
will timeout prior to OSD's actually joing the Ceph storage
cluster as usable storage is required for this operation.

Change-Id: I6c5442edc2fb25ff37d7a4bd0bc49aabd6f2d24c
Closes-Bug: 1577519

commit_message:
Fix grenade exclusion for ironic

This adds to the grenade regex that excludes it from running on
stable versions of ironic, where it doesn't work, to include the -nv
suffix if it exists.

It also removes the "voting: False" bit because it shouldn't even bother
running.

Change-Id: I5e33e5f687b849b738275aeac3dc7e607ad44a4e

commit_message:
Initial commit adds VNFFG Extension capable of creating SFC and Classifiers

VNFFG Extension used to support the Service Function Chaining.  Includes
resources to create chains and classifiers to classify traffic on to the
chains per tacker-sfc spec.  Also includes updates to validators to
accomodate some of the required Classifier match criteria.  Not all
match criteria is contained in this patch and will be added later.

Changes Include:
 - VNFFG Extension
 - VNFFG Plugin/DB (includes SFC and Classifier)
 - VNFFG Noop Driver

Change-Id: I8da751369f35e44a34f7037eaadd1974c1c22a1b
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Repair fuelweb_admin network metadata

When upgrade from version 6.0 to 8.0, the fuelweb_admin network metadata
is restored from version 6.0. However, since version 6.1, certain params
in the metadata changed, which is reflected in fixture/admin_network.json
file.

Set 'gateway' field for network group 'fuelweb_admin' to the address
of the Fuel Master node.

Set 'vip_type' field in ip_addrs table for the 'fuelweb_admin' to NULL.

Change-Id: Ice94dcb7826b5357b9aaab56ea1632d77160db5e
Partial-bug: 1573075

commit_message:
Escape angularjs templating in unsafe HTML

This code extends the unsafe (typically user-supplied) HTML escape
built into Django to also escape angularjs templating markers. Safe
HTML will be unaffected.

Closes-bug: 1567673
Change-Id: I0cbebfd0f814bdf1bf8c06833abf33cc2d4748e7
(cherry picked from commit 4bc01cedf39cdeff2553d01cdace707a1ecf6620)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/97/329997/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from horizon.utils.escape import monkeypatch_escape # this is used to protect from client XSS attacks, but it's worth # enabling in our test setup to find any issues it might cause monkeypatch_escape()

Add the type:packaging to DEB/RPM

The DEB and RPM packaging projects need a type:packaging tag if
we bother creating the tag.

commit_message:
[WIP] Do not merge

This patch contains changes required to get the ContainerShareDriver [1]
to work with NeutronBindNetworkPlugin [2].

[1] I711813a2022d765ab7a70ed670e34f68f9cf1399
[2] I3156d7468d48f84f1b46885780a2426f9b99a387

Change-Id: I1cca8e57583980e3ef6270d49da4553da407ff30
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/61/330561/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.config = self.neutron_api.configuration def update_network_allocation(self, context, share_server): if self.config.neutron_vnic_type == 'normal': ports = self.db.network_allocations_get_for_share_server( context, share_server['id']) self._wait_for_ports_bind(ports, share_server, self.config.neutron_bind_timeout) return ports return None def _wait_for_ports_bind(self, ports, share_server, timeout=240): if self.config.neutron_host_id: args['host_id'] = self.config.neutron_host_id self.config.neutron_vnic_type) def allocate_network(self, context, share_server, share_network=None, **kwargs): # If vnic type is 'normal' we expect a neutron agent to bind the # ports. So we wait until the agent has done its job before returning # the allocated ports. # If vnic type is not 'normal', it might be necessary for the share # driver to configure networking on the share server before the ports # can be bound. Therefore we do not wait for the port binding here, but # return the unbound ports and expect the share manager to call # update_network_allocation after the share server was created, in # order to update the ports with the correct binding. if self.config.neutron_vnic_type != 'normal': self._wait_for_ports_bind(ports, share_server, self.config.neutron_bind_timeout)
deleted_lines: if not self.neutron_api.has_port_binding_extension(): raise exception.NetworkBadConfigurationException( "Binding network driver configured but neutron doesn't " "support port binding.") def _wait_for_ports_bind(self, context, ports, share_server, timeout=240): if self.neutron_api.configuration.neutron_host_id: args['host_id'] = self.neutron_api.configuration.neutron_host_id self.neutron_api.configuration.neutron_vnic_type) def allocate_network(self, context, share_server, share_network, **kwargs): config = self.neutron_api.configuration self._wait_for_ports_bind(context, ports, share_server, config.neutron_bind_timeout)

commit_message:
Fixing Kubernetes DNS root and adding some debugging instructions

Others were having difficulty replicating my steps.  I realized
that the previous doc patch was missing one detail and also added
some debugging steps.

Change-Id: I6f09f8de8b03c96a789f7cc03fdd3ae0f5a69247
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/72/330272/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: docker run --volume=/:/rootfs:ro --volume=/sys:/sys:rw --volume=/var/lib/docker/:/var/lib/docker:rw --volume=/var/lib/kubelet/:/var/lib/kubelet:rw,shared --volume=/var/run:/var/run:rw --net=host --pid=host --privileged=true --name=kubelet -d gcr.io/google_containers/hyperkube-amd64:v1.2.4 /hyperkube kubelet --resolv-conf="" --containerized --hostname-override="127.0.0.1" --address="0.0.0.0" --api-servers=http://localhost:8080 --config=/etc/kubernetes/manifests --cluster-domain=openstack.local --allow-privileged=true --v=2 --cluster-dns= Debugging ========= kube2sky -------- kube2sky queries Kubernetes and builds out the necessary etcd records for SkyDNS to use. To check to see if the Kubernetes service has been copied over from Kubernetes to SkyDNS, you can check the etcd:: curl http://127.0.0.1:4001/v2/keys/skydns/local/openstack/svc/default/kubernetes You should see something like this:: {"action":"get","node":{"key":"/skydns/local/openstack/svc/default/kubernetes","dir":true,"nodes":[{"key":"/skydns/local/openstack/svc/default/kubernetes/c88f1059","value":"{\"host\":\"10.0.0.1\",\"priority\":10,\"weight\":10,\"ttl\":30,\"targetstrip\":0}","modifiedIndex":137,"createdIndex":137}],"modifiedIndex":92,"createdIndex":92}} That is the DNS record for the Kubernetes service. SkyDNS ------ SkyDNS is a DNS server that serves up data stored in etcd. After you have verified that kube2sky is creating the necessary records in etcd, you can check to see if the SkyDNS server is responding:: nslookup kubernetes.default.svc.openstack.local 127.0.0.1 You should see something like this:: Server: 127.0.0.1 Address: 127.0.0.1#53 Name: kubernetes.default.svc.openstack.local Address: 10.0.0.1 From inside a Kubernetes pod, you can use:: nslookup kubernetes
deleted_lines: docker run --volume=/:/rootfs:ro --volume=/sys:/sys:rw --volume=/var/lib/docker/:/var/lib/docker:rw --volume=/var/lib/kubelet/:/var/lib/kubelet:rw,shared --volume=/var/run:/var/run:rw --net=host --pid=host --privileged=true --name=kubelet -d gcr.io/google_containers/hyperkube-amd64:v1.2.4 /hyperkube kubelet --resolv-conf="" --containerized --hostname-override="127.0.0.1" --address="0.0.0.0" --api-servers=http://localhost:8080 --config=/etc/kubernetes/manifests --cluster-domain=openstack --allow-privileged=true --v=2 --cluster-dns=

commit_message:
Add re-initialization of the master node

PuppetApplyHost is renamed to PuppetApplyTasks to perform full
re-initialization of the master node by applying all puppet tasks.

Change-Id: I52a02fd4e72c1fd6367f91f088beacc0e9715969

commit_message:
Remove containers related code from mirrors

This patch runs SQL queries on the host side instead of doing this
inside of the postgres container. This is needed as a part of the work
for removing docker containers from the master node.

Closes-Bug: #1592802
Change-Id: Ied8dde10908b275399080308af3f00f440ba36a2

commit_message:
Create releases only if they are absent

To support the backup/restore feature of a master node within one
release already presented release should not be loaded twice. This
change makes the ReleaseArchivator handler idempotent.

Change-Id: Id5b3130fe7e4e836cac1661639052db25a48050f

commit_message:
Properly extend fixtures from openstack.yaml

Fixtures should be properly extended from the 'extend' attribute for all
embedded objects to support at least two nested levels. That is needed
to cover two Ubuntu releases dependent on one another in 9.0 or some
custom fixtures with a variable number of releases and their
dependencies.

Closes-Bug: #1592741
Change-Id: Ib74cc0656e0f7fec3e1b3de3ac4cc4fd83e45d99
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/55/330255/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: base_release_fields = fixtures[0]['fields'] for fixture in fixtures[1:]: release = dict(helpers.merge_dicts( base_release_fields, fixture['fields']))

commit_message:
Remove code that sets the deployed_before flag

The deployed_before flag is not more required attribute of cluster
since the 9.0 release [1]. This patch removes the respective function
that is responsible for setting the flag for all cluster as a part of
the database restore procedure.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/292804

Change-Id: I22f4c5d9365af44326363de6bb57e132e1384c7a

commit_message:
Remove containers specifics from DB archivators

Since nailgun and keystone services are not isolated in containers their
processes should be stopped before to manipulate with databases and
data.

DB archivators are collected in DatabasesArchivator to apply the
'postgresql' task before to restore DB states. This task is needed to
configure databases, users and privileges according new parameters in
astute.yaml.

Some new functions were introduced to perform respective operations on
the host level, such as:
  - archivate.archivate_cmd_output
  - sql.run_psql

Change-Id: I67145808e8c453e371fe20575c5cc6a729db139a

commit_message:
Remove containers specifics from CobblerArchivator

Some manipulations with services were removed from this archivator
because puppet tasks will be re-used to re-initialize the master node.

PathFilterArchivator was added to support the simillar functionality
that ContainerArchivator provides but perform all operations in the
host filesystem.

Change-Id: I46c7f9980f1cb8696a340e663101bec1711f4247

commit_message:
Remove docker related code from AstuteArchivator

Since the removing docker containers from the host re-initialization of
services should be done by applying puppet manifests. The code that
responsible for doing this with containers were removed from
AstuteArchivator and now this archivator responsible only for restoring
the astute.yaml file, this re-initialization will be added as a separate
archivator.

Change-Id: Ied3b5132e9dce1c37b259f74d76c93f56dbcdf67

commit_message:
Bump version of keystoneauth1 to 2.7

Keystonemiddleware requires access to features released in keystoneauth
2.7. The latest version of keystoneauth is 2.8 however these are mostly
testing and OIDC changes that aren't required in the general case.

Change-Id: I81a754379819d0afcf51cb3c02dff15e36b07ece

commit_message:
Add function to run puppet tasks on a master node

Since the 9.0 release on a master node all services were moved from
docker containrs into the system namespace. All of these services are
initialized by puppet manifests that are organized in tasks for each
component, such as cobbler, nailgun, keystone, etc. The added function
provides an ability to apply one task by its name.

Change-Id: I301f8cacae87d5a64d3e99a2b351c00663b6db0a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/92/328192/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @pytest.mark.parametrize("name", ["cobbler", "nailgun"]) @pytest.mark.parametrize(("returncode", "is_error"), [ (0, False), (1, True), (2, False), (4, True), (6, True), ]) def test_apply_task(mock_subprocess, name, returncode, is_error): filename = "/etc/puppet/modules/fuel/examples/{0}.pp".format(name) cmd = ['puppet', 'apply', '-d', '-v', "--color", "false", '--detailed-exitcodes', filename] if is_error: mock_subprocess.side_effect = \ subprocess.CalledProcessError(returncode, 'CMD') with pytest.raises(subprocess.CalledProcessError): puppet_util.apply_task(name) else: puppet_util.apply_task(name) mock_subprocess.assert_called_once_with(cmd)

commit_message:
Disable unsupported archivators

Docker containers where removed in the 9.0 release on the mater node
that is why unsupported archivators were disabled in this changes to be
able re-write them one-by-one.

A list of archivators that use containers and should be modified:
 -  astute.AstuteArchivator
 -  cobbler.CobblerArchivator
 -  puppet.PuppetArchivator
 -  postgres.KeystoneArchivator
 -  postgres.NailgunArchivator
 -  release.ReleaseArchivator
 -  logs.LogsArchivator
 -  puppet.PuppetApplyHost

Change-Id: I62f56070855ad4d8165c167bca6df0a97ad798c9

commit_message:
Add support for glance-api-ready relation flag

It's useful for service related to glance to know when it thinks
that its ready to start accepting requests, so that images can
be uploaded into Glance by other services in the cloud.

Add a 'glance-api-ready' flag to the image-service relation and
set status based on required interfaces being complete.

Change-Id: I28eba6f5fbc009b3c1e07a1180a85ddd17939404
Partial-Bug: 1528390
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-glance refs/changes/80/330680/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix flake8 issues

I have improved the readability of the code by fixing the
problems that flake8 reported.

The type of errors that are fixed are:
    * H302 - Import only module
    * H305 - Import not grouped correctly
    * H307 - Like imports shoud be grouped together
    * H402 - One line docstring needs punctation
    * F821 - Undefined name

Change-Id: I3a7f12120b6a99342a3d2025206edcdc0f6a4a93
Signed-off-by: Costin Galan <cgalan@cloudbasesolutions.com>

commit_message:
Use 'trimmed' for blocktrans in html page

blocktrans trimmed option removes newlines from contents of blocktrans
and replaces any whitespace at the beginning and end of a line into
a single space. This makes translator life easier.
More detail is described in the bug report.

Change-Id: Ic63629a1afe5606a58797ed69bf847447cad9c02
Closes-Bug: #1585428

subject: Fix Nailgun unavailability dialog
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 12:05:16.000000000', 'files': ['static/app.js'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ui/commit/5c0259e946dbed734b3bdf16727234c906c19182', 'message': "Fix Nailgun unavailability dialog

It was broken after upgrading jQuery to v3. It happend due to
backwards-incompatible changes in deferreds handling:

The resolution state of a Deferred created by .then() is now
controlled by its callbacks - exceptions become rejection
values and non-thenable returns become fulfillment values.
Previously, returns from rejection handlers became rejection
values.

Now it's required to explicitly return rejected promise from
rejection handler in app bootstrap promise chain.

Closes-Bug: #1592788

Change-Id: I2f1512fb421109bb9bc5063b7a314f5d53e16b1d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Nailgun unavailability dialog

It was broken after upgrading jQuery to v3. It happend due to
backwards-incompatible changes in deferreds handling:

The resolution state of a Deferred created by .then() is now
controlled by its callbacks - exceptions become rejection
values and non-thenable returns become fulfillment values.
Previously, returns from rejection handlers became rejection
values.

Now it's required to explicitly return rejected promise from
rejection handler in app bootstrap promise chain.

Closes-Bug: #1592788

Change-Id: I2f1512fb421109bb9bc5063b7a314f5d53e16b1d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ui refs/changes/09/331109/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return $.Deferred().reject();

commit_message:
Change to tempest stable API

Previously several places in murano tempest test use unstable tempest
api. In fact, it should use api from tempest.lib.* [1]. So fixed them
to make them more robust and resilient to tempest changes. The
unstable api removed here include:
  * tempest.clients
  * tempest.test

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/plugin.html#stable-tempest-apis-plugins-may-use

Change-Id: I018b00cc026a707da6afe40a327b44e97c16db53
Related-Bug: #1589713

commit_message:
Huawei: Add manage share snapshot in Huawei driver

Manage share snapshot on the array,
before managing the snapshot, make sure that the
source share is managed by OpenStack.

Implements: blueprint huawei-driver-manage-snapshot
Change-Id: I085106dccec5d371771fa112898e980bae182d11

commit_message:
Fix tempest tests

Base TempestException was removed  from tempest, now exceptions based on
tempest.lib TempestException, inherited from restclient exceptions.
So inherit inspector tempest exceptions from last one.

Change-Id: I8058a964e837dbb4aa5a8b214f216453a18a1713

commit_message:
split ironic install role into install,bootstrap,start phases

- This change decomposes the install ironic role into 3 phases.
- The install phase will install all packages.
- The bootstrap phase generates all config files and configures the db.
- The start phase starts all biforst/ironic services.
- This change adds 3 new variable
  (skip_package_install, skip_bootstrap, skip_start) to optionally
  skip the install, bootstrap and start phases
- This change splits the inspector_install.yml to reflect the 3 phases.

Change-Id: Ifdfc935f594e29eb361ac31e8ae328744848258b

commit_message:
Rearrange lcm tests

Idempotency and ensurability tests have the general
base test which prepares environment.
So, their combination in the same groups
optimizes run of these tests

Change-Id: I8181eb4556aa68d41d15fb4c8df356b4fdc10992
Closes-bug: #1587958
(cherry picked from commit 6d49738a9bd5eaf1b7113f1adc953263521790d2)

commit_message:
Add pool listing to python designate client

Pool listing is required in downstream apps
which use python designate client like searchlight
to retrive list of pool.

Change-Id: I44d3a53d2b490fe9a4cca3858734ca70bb5e0f88
Closes-Bug: #1563497

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-15 18:51:11.000000000', 'files': ['designate/api/v2/controllers/zones/tasks/imports.py', 'designate/api/v2/controllers/zones/tasks/exports.py', 'designate/api/v2/controllers/zones/tasks/abandon.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/7d6ac0a875ea35227620b8866e2d30ec6e6efa69', 'message': "Ensure HTTP 204 responses have 0 Content-Length

These calls are misusing Pecan, and result in '' getting
serialized to JSON, which has a non-empty content-length
and that's against the rules of HTTP

closes-bug: 1592153

Change-Id: I1407d29c537273b07ab54c4e58c70d9bc4214759
(cherry picked from commit 3171dd5103aa7295b3947cafc35184ccfb9c9659)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure HTTP 204 responses have 0 Content-Length

These calls are misusing Pecan, and result in '' getting
serialized to JSON, which has a non-empty content-length
and that's against the rules of HTTP

closes-bug: 1592153

Change-Id: I1407d29c537273b07ab54c4e58c70d9bc4214759
(cherry picked from commit 3171dd5103aa7295b3947cafc35184ccfb9c9659)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/53/330153/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: @pecan.expose(template='json:', content_type='application/json') # NOTE: This is a hack and a half.. But Pecan needs it.

commit_message:
Deprecate lbaas v1 resources

Lbaas V1 API is deprecated and is planned to be removed
in the future. So we need to deprecate according resources.

Change-Id: I91474034aed9fcd686f0f1192507c9b3a0a99beb

commit_message:
Add support for building Centos 7 images for CDH 5.5

This commit adds support for diskimage-create.sh to create
Centos 7 images with CDH 5.5.
There are also minor changes to the repo definitions for
Centos/RHEL to use the $releasever variable
Also modifies the gate script to create the Centos 7 image

Change-Id: I9d563bdb5f5a1eb0243db376bf28113e8c416511
Closes-Bug: #1581233

"$HADOOP_VERSION" = "5.5" ] then echo -e "Unsupported version combination, Centos 7 can only be used with CDH 5.5" exit 1 fi if [ -z "$BASE_IMAGE_OS" -o "$BASE_IMAGE_OS" = "centos7" ]; then if [ -z "$HADOOP_VERSION" -o "$HADOOP_VERSION" = "5.5" ]; then export DIB_CDH_VERSION="5.5" cloudera_5_5_centos7_image_name=${cloudera_5_5_centos7_image_name:-centos7_sahara_cloudera_5_5_0} cloudera_elements_sequence="hadoop-cloudera selinux-permissive disable-firewall" image_create centos7 $cloudera_5_5_centos7_image_name $cloudera_elements_sequence unset DIB_CDH_VERSION fi fi

commit_message:
Handle quota exceed exception

This patch solves two problems:

1. Code duplication about handling quota exceed exceptions.

2. When extending a volume, if OverQuota is caught, Cinder
raised VolumeSizeExceedsAvailableQuota with data from
quota gigabytes. This is not correct, as it may exceed
gigabytes of volume type.

This patch is to transfer quota data from gigabytes or
[volume_type_name]gigabytes to VolumeSizeExceedsAvailableQuota.

3. Raise new exception if overs are not expected.

Change-Id: I811ce51a4aefe8a99f0f5197ab071212322c584d
Closes-bug: 1546890
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/66/281666/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name=over, overs = exc.kwargs['overs'] for over in overs: if 'gigabytes' in over: msg = _LE("Quota exceeded for %(s_pid)s, tried to " "extend volume by %(s_size)sG, " "(%(d_consumed)dG of %(d_quota)dG " "already consumed).") LOG.error(msg, {'s_pid': context.project_id, 's_size': size_increase, 'd_consumed': _consumed(over), 'd_quota': quotas[over]}) raise exception.VolumeSizeExceedsAvailableQuota( name=over, requested=size_increase, consumed=_consumed(over), quota=quotas[over])
deleted_lines: msg = _LE("Quota exceeded for %(s_pid)s, tried to extend volume " "by %(s_size)sG, (%(d_consumed)dG of %(d_quota)dG " "already consumed).") LOG.error(msg, {'s_pid': context.project_id, 's_size': size_increase, 'd_consumed': _consumed('gigabytes'), 'd_quota': quotas['gigabytes']}) raise exception.VolumeSizeExceedsAvailableQuota( requested=size_increase, consumed=_consumed('gigabytes'), quota=quotas['gigabytes'])

Reduce code duplication (in the ssc_cmode.py)

Reduced source code by extracting duplicated code
(cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/ssc_cmode.py)
I created a new function instead of "Ctrl-C + Ctrl-V"

added_lines: def _spec_ineffect(b_specs, spec, opp_spec): """If the spec with opposite spec is ineffective.""" if ((b_specs[spec] is None and b_specs[opp_spec] is None) or (b_specs[spec] == b_specs[opp_spec])): return True else: return False def _set_result(_b_specs, _key_1, _key_2, _key_3, _result, _ssc_vols): """Collect SSC volumes""" if _spec_ineffect(_b_specs, _key_1, _key_2): pass else: if _b_specs[_key_1] or _b_specs[_key_2] is False: _result = _result & _ssc_vols[_key_3] else: _result = _result - _ssc_vols[_key_3] return _result result = _set_result(b_specs, 'netapp_mirrored', 'netapp_unmirrored', 'mirrored', result, ssc_vols) result = _set_result(b_specs, 'netapp_dedup', 'netapp_nodedup', 'dedup', result, ssc_vols) result = _set_result(b_specs, 'netapp_compression', 'netapp_nocompression', 'compression', result, ssc_vols) result = _set_result(b_specs, 'netapp_thin_provisioned', 'netapp_thick_provisioned', 'thin', result, ssc_vols)
deleted_lines: def _spec_ineffect(b_specs, spec, opp_spec): """If the spec with opposite spec is ineffective.""" if ((b_specs[spec] is None and b_specs[opp_spec] is None) or (b_specs[spec] == b_specs[opp_spec])): return True else: return False if _spec_ineffect(b_specs, 'netapp_mirrored', 'netapp_unmirrored'): pass else: if b_specs['netapp_mirrored'] or b_specs['netapp_unmirrored'] is False: result = result & ssc_vols['mirrored'] else: result = result - ssc_vols['mirrored'] if _spec_ineffect(b_specs, 'netapp_dedup', 'netapp_nodedup'): pass else: if b_specs['netapp_dedup'] or b_specs['netapp_nodedup'] is False: result = result & ssc_vols['dedup'] else: result = result - ssc_vols['dedup'] if _spec_ineffect(b_specs, 'netapp_compression', 'netapp_nocompression'): pass else: if (b_specs['netapp_compression'] or b_specs['netapp_nocompression'] is False): result = result & ssc_vols['compression'] else: result = result - ssc_vols['compression'] if _spec_ineffect(b_specs, 'netapp_thin_provisioned', 'netapp_thick_provisioned'): pass else: if (b_specs['netapp_thin_provisioned'] or b_specs['netapp_thick_provisioned'] is False): result = result & ssc_vols['thin'] else: result = result - ssc_vols['thin']

commit_message:
Remove use of deprecated network_resources module

tempest has removed the network_resources module in the recent
commit causing gate to fail. This commit fixes the same.

Change-Id: I582ddb06464ef7290b1595ac59b8ffdfdf7bade4

commit_message:
Use OS_{USERNAME,PASSWORD} env variables for auth

The deprecated environments variables, such as KEYSTONE_USER and
KEYSTONE_PASSWORD, are no longer supported by the fuel client and were
changed on the actual ones, such as OS_USERNAME and OS_PASSWORD, in this
patch.

Change-Id: Id015b0426ca8ba93a947c68d9d8e1e207f1b91ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/36/330836/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: env["OS_USERNAME"] = self.user env["OS_PASSWORD"] = self.password
deleted_lines: env["KEYSTONE_USER"] = self.user env["KEYSTONE_PASS"] = self.password

commit_message:
Remove PyMI

This is currently not used by any projects managed by requirements.

After digging through manila patches, the latest patch for any updates
related PyMI is updated 7 months before.

Change-Id: Ia1c670a1cc6668e2c3e96d651163efa5eaba6c67

commit_message:
Stable mitaka release for instack-undercloud

Cut a release for the instack-undercloud component.

The previous 4.0.0 release was tagged directly, so this adds the
deliverable and continues the numbering with a 4.1.0 release.

Note this has been validated via the following periodic CI:

http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/periodic-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ha-mitaka/d3b1c10/console.html

Change-Id: Iaa22fb4d7238f48392a5b8cec35946926f08c8c2

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-16 19:58:47.000000000', 'files': ['announce.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/release-tools/commit/9cc176af01b19da382598bd6153fbfc26525b678', 'message': "treat missing metadata as a warning not an error

Rather than exit with an error when the metadata is not present, report

Change-Id: If87b49fda044a54326a8bca600226ad838106027
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
treat missing metadata as a warning not an error

Rather than exit with an error when the metadata is not present, report
a warning and exit with a passing status code. That way the CI job won't
fail.

Change-Id: If87b49fda044a54326a8bca600226ad838106027
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/64/330764/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "WARNING: Missing meta lines in $VERSION tag message," echo " skipping announcement." echo echo "Was the tag for $VERSION created with release.sh?" exit 0
deleted_lines: echo ERROR: Missing meta lines in $VERSION tag message. exit 1

commit_message:
OpenStack networking test report

The report cintains results collected at 200 node scale
with Neutron OVS plugin, VxLAN and DVR.

Change-Id: I64c9aeaa9b5b52575647b16d23cc0e0d270d1eaa

commit_message:
Initial LB VIF Type

This is the initial change set that starts the Linux Bridge VIF Type
work for PowerVM.  It should support connecting to the Neutron Linux
Bridge Agent for OpenStack.

Change-Id: I93af62a21f6cc22685a7d1f30643475c161265f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/47/302447/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Copyright 2016 IBM Corp. # # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Starter script for PowerVM Nova Conductor service.""" from nova.cmd import conductor from nova_powervm import objects def main(): # The only reason we need this module is to ensure the PowerVM version of # the migrate data object is registered. See: # http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/ # %23openstack-nova.2016-02-24.log.html objects.register_all() conductor.main()

subject: Unplug vifs when VM create failed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 02:29:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d4070e69794bbe48b70db72cb55dd41be9c5fae0', 'message': 'Create VM failed, unplug vifs

Currently, when create VM failed(such as "_create_domain"
execute failed), do not unplug-ports.When create VM,
update network_info at table "instance_info_caches".
But it will be delayed for some time.
At "_shutdown_instance", we can not get the correct
network_info from "instance_info_caches".If the type of
ports is sriov, the mac and vlan of vf will not be cleaned.

When we can not get correct network_info, We should
add a parameter of "network_info" at function
"_shutdown_instance".

Change-Id: I08d3f7992990e1e4c5b5e9400416259d21ade6be

Currently, when create VM failed(such as "_create_domain"
execute failed), do not unplug-ports correctly.

When rollback of VM create failed, we can not get the correct
network_info from "instance_info_caches". For example, If the
type of ports is sriov, the mac and vlan of vf will not be clear.

Change-Id: I08d3f7992990e1e4c5b5e9400416259d21ade6be
Closes-Bug: #1567843

commit_message:
Unplug vifs when VM create failed

Currently, when create VM failed(such as "_create_domain"
execute failed), do not unplug-ports correctly.

When rollback of VM create failed, we can not get the correct
network_info from "instance_info_caches". For example, If the
type of ports is sriov, the mac and vlan of vf will not be clear.

Change-Id: I08d3f7992990e1e4c5b5e9400416259d21ade6be
Closes-Bug: #1567843

commit_message:
Use quickstart.sh to manage venv in all ci-scripts

We currently have a step to activate the venv in the collect-logs,
get-node, and return-node scripts. The collect-logs script does
not need it at all anymore, and the {get,return}-node scripts can
instead pull in python-cicoclient via a requirements file.

Change-Id: I9754eae93942d9a89f77c0a2d8cc9839c537c39d

commit_message:
Allow passing extra arguments to overcloud deploy script

The overcloud-deploy.sh script that's deployed into the undercloud is
very useful by itself. However, there are times where the installed
values are not enough to test something quickly. So this adds the
ability to pass extra arguments to the "openstack overcloud deploy"
that's within that script.

Change-Id: I4cad387da74a31c534cf809609eced646dd45f3a

commit_message:
Use absolute paths for OPT_WORKDIR

Ansible has a slight preference for absolute paths in some
cases/modules. For example, `with_file` requires an absolute path,
otherwise it'll append the relative path to the work dir where commands
are being run from.

Change-Id: I15713106cd8de2a3e0fb4478d032cedf79c41d61
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/30/330930/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: OPT_WORKDIR=$2

commit_message:
report extra files with warnings

If the user forgets to add the .yaml extension, we ignore the
file. Instead of doing that silently, report that we see something and
that we're ignoring it.

Change-Id: I18130951a09a216339d3b63dc7decc67e766ee2d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/reno refs/changes/13/330813/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: filenames = [] for f in hlines[2:]: if fnmatch.fnmatch(f, notesdir + '/*.yaml'): filenames.append(f) elif fnmatch.fnmatch(f, notesdir + '/*'): LOG.warn('found and ignored extra file %s', f)
deleted_lines: filenames = [ f for f in hlines[2:] if fnmatch.fnmatch(f, notesdir + '/*.yaml') ]

commit_message:
Delete reduplicate code in test_compute_mgr.py

build_resources_with_network_info_obj_on_spawn_failure,
test_build_resources_cleans_up_and_reraises_on_spawn_failure.
the content of the cases are exactly the same.
So delete one of them.

Change-Id: I49a7834dad3ec223757e1b91daa6dcb1dd9b9d06

commit_message:
fix the pattern matching in the constraint update logic

When cliff 2.1.0 was released, the constraint for "cliff-tablib" was
replaced with "cliff==2.1.0". This fixes the regex used in the sed
command to be a more exact match.

Change-Id: I435e42b25b13d12504b703e4c0ca64f385435ebe
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add period property to Monasca Notification resource

Currently, when one of Monasca's alarm transitions to the ALARM state, the
webhook associated with the Alarm is only invoked once. This is inconvenient
when the user wants to create a stack which will automatically scale up
or scale down more than once if the alarm state continues to be in the same
state.

The new added property 'PERIOD' will now allow the user to tell Monasca to
periodically invoke the webhook until the ALARM state transitions back to an OK
state.

To conform to the existing Heat autoscaling behaviour, we manually create the
monasca notification resource in Heat with a default value of 60 only for the
webhook notification type.

Change-Id: I2466911efa8d05dfe497f521885464ab90b0ae8e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/47/325147/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: NAME, TYPE, ADDRESS 'name', 'type', 'address' address=self.properties[self.ADDRESS]

commit_message:
Add timeout to deploy.sh

So we can properly generate logs as there looks to be an issue with
overcloud timeout.

Change-Id: Ibb22e35b64671c41894c56e65f4246f604cf2f2e
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/34/326634/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: ssh $SSH_OPTIONS root@${SEED_IP} <<-EOF

commit_message:
Switch to using charm-store for amulet tests

All OpenStack charms are now directly published to the charm store
on landing; switch Amulet helper to resolve charms using the
charm store rather than bzr branches, removing the lag between
charm changes landing and being available for other charms to
use for testing.

This is also important for new layered charms where the charm must
be build and published prior to being consumable.

Change-Id: I69687d6064c6a485fcb789220e5603054e775ddf

commit_message:
remove unneeded _client method for keystone

there is no more usages in sahara code. method
can be removed

deleted_lines: # TODO(elmiko) deprecate this when all client have been migrated to sessions def _client(username, password=None, token=None, tenant_name=None, tenant_id=None, trust_id=None, domain_name=None): if trust_id and not CONF.use_identity_api_v3: raise Exception("Trusts aren't implemented in keystone api" " less than v3") auth_url = base.retrieve_auth_url( endpoint_type=CONF.keystone.endpoint_type) client_kwargs = {'username': username, 'password': password, 'token': token, 'tenant_name': tenant_name, 'tenant_id': tenant_id, 'trust_id': trust_id, 'user_domain_name': domain_name, 'auth_url': auth_url, 'cacert': CONF.keystone.ca_file, 'insecure': CONF.keystone.api_insecure } if CONF.use_identity_api_v3: keystone = keystone_client_v3.Client(**client_kwargs) keystone.management_url = auth_url else: keystone = keystone_client.Client(**client_kwargs) return keystone

commit_message:
Escape angularjs templating in unsafe HTML

This code extends the unsafe (typically user-supplied) HTML escape
built into Django to also escape angularjs templating markers. Safe
HTML will be unaffected.

Closes-bug: 1567673
Change-Id: I0cbebfd0f814bdf1bf8c06833abf33cc2d4748e7
(cherry picked from commit 4bc01cedf39cdeff2553d01cdace707a1ecf6620)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/96/329996/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from horizon.utils.escape import monkeypatch_escape # this is used to protect from client XSS attacks, but it's worth # enabling in our test setup to find any issues it might cause monkeypatch_escape()

subject: WIP Extend ResourceProvider to have resources and aggregates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-25 22:26:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/26645d78fa2d8c285b17efb67592918d1c5222ab', 'message': 'WIP Add ResourcePool object

A ResourcePool is a facade over a ResourceProvider, an Inventory, a
ResourceProviderAggregate and an Allocation. It is possible to
create a ResourcePool, assign resources (inventories), and
associate aggregates.

This isn't done, posting for feedback. It took me quite a while to
settle on how to do this, and I'm still not confident that I've
got it working in a way that is correct. The logic for why it is the
way it is can sort of be seen in the functional test. From the
standpoint of someone using the API, they'll post up an id, some
aggregates, and some inventories. The errors sent back to the
user-agent can be more granular by:

* creating or getting the resource provider
* getting the aggregates
* validating the provided inventories by creating them
* doing the association of the resource provider and the aggregate
* assembling the response by calculating the resources for
  each inventory

There's a lot of this where I've thought "I bet Jay wants me to do
this all in SQL" and at the same time "I bet Dan wants me to do this
all in ovo". So that confusion is probably evident here. Have fun
giving me feedback.

Out of steam for now, loads more tests tomorrow.

Change-Id: I5b7dcee81bf37272a012fdfb0c5c8e8c2305045e

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-26 20:33:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/830c7f006f53eb63d2e2b670ed5772189bf6aac7', 'message': 'WIP Add ResourcePool object

A ResourcePool is a facade over a ResourceProvider, an Inventory, a
ResourceProviderAggregate and an Allocation. It is possible to
create a ResourcePool, assign resources (inventories),
associate aggregates and retrieve resource usage information.

This isn't done, posting for feedback. It took me quite a while to
settle on how to do this, and I'm still not confident that I've
got it working in a way that is correct. The logic for why it is the
way it is can sort of be seen in the functional test. From the
standpoint of someone using the API, they'll post up an id, some
aggregates, and some inventories. The errors sent back to the
user-agent can be more granular by:

* creating or getting the resource provider
* getting the aggregates
* validating the provided inventories by creating them
* doing the association of the resource provider and the aggregate
* assembling the response by calculating the resources for
  each inventory

There's a lot of this where I've thought "I bet Jay wants me to do
this all in SQL" and at the same time "I bet Dan wants me to do this
all in ovo". So that confusion is probably evident here. Have fun
giving me feedback.

I've gone ahead and added a resource property that gets a thing which
looks like an Inventory object but with the used field added. Doing
this has exposed a potential issue with a lack of Unique Constraint
on the Inventories table. It has also generated a bunch of noisy
code that seems to violate the whole ovo model. But at least it has
allowed me to express the API, we can get it back to sane based on
feedback.

Change-Id: I5b7dcee81bf37272a012fdfb0c5c8e8c2305045e

"}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2016-03-15 19:40:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/dc7f0322a783022c88045118a1362b1b9f680149', 'message': "Add ResourcePool and ResourcePoolList objects

A ResourcePool is a facade over a ResourceProvider, an Inventory, a
ResourceProviderAggregate and an Allocation. It is possible to
create a ResourcePool, assign resources (inventories),
associate aggregates and retrieve resource usage information.

From the standpoint of someone using the API, they'll post up an
id, some aggregates, and some inventories. The errors sent back
to the user-agent can be more granular by:

* creating or getting the resource provider
* getting the aggregates
* validating the provided inventories by creating them
* doing the association of the resource provider and the aggregate
* assembling the response by calculating the resources for
  each inventory

There is a resources property that gets a thing which looks like an
Inventory object but with the used field added.

ResourcePoolList has a single classmethod to get_all(), which will
construct ResourcePool objects for all ResourceProviders that are
associated with an aggregate.

Change-Id: I5b7dcee81bf37272a012fdfb0c5c8e8c2305045e

id, some aggregates, and some inventories. The errors sent back
to the user-agent can be more granular by:

* creating or getting the resource provider
* getting the aggregates
* validating the provided inventories by creating them
* doing the association of the resource provider and the aggregate
* assembling the response by calculating the resources for
  each inventory

There is a resources property that gets a thing which looks like an
Inventory object but with the used field added.

ResourcePoolList has a single classmethod to get_all(), which will
construct ResourcePool objects for all ResourceProviders that are
associated with an aggregate.

Change-Id: I5b7dcee81bf37272a012fdfb0c5c8e8c2305045e

'}, {'number': 39, 'created': '2016-04-22 19:49:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/11f96419c2874336ed8288e13fa270762992d940', 'message': 'Extend ResourceProvider to have resources and aggregates

A ResourceProvider now provides facade over an Inventory, a
ResourceProviderAggregate and an Allocation. It is possible to
create a ResourcePool, create inventories that are associated with
that ResourcePool, associate and disassociate aggregates and
retrieve resources usage information.

aggregates and resources are loaded lazily

When a ResourceProvider is destroyed the allocations, inventories
and ResourceProviderAggregates associated with it are destroyed too.

A ResourceProviderList now exists with a single classmethod to
get_all(), which will construct ResourceProvider objects for all
ResourceProviders that are not compute nodes. This satisfies the
needs the resource pools api. The disjoint in name may need to
be resolved, if we care.

Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
Change-Id: I5b7dcee81bf37272a012fdfb0c5c8e8c2305045e

'}, {'number': 48, 'created': '2016-05-11 23:49:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4fc023a49f17da57f963631d07644bdcc7cdf348', 'message': 'Extend ResourceProvider to have resources and aggregates

A ResourceProvider now provides a facade over an Inventory, a
ResourceProviderAggregate and an Allocation. It is possible to
create a ResourcePool, and update its resources and associated
aggregates.

Resources and aggregates are updated under the domain of the object
updating itself (this puts the object in alignment with the state
management done in the resource pools API). It is also possible to
update resources by independently creating Inventory objects with
the correctly associated resource provider. Doing so, however, skips
some of the validation checks that the resource provider does:

* a resource cannot have its `total` or `reserved` changed such that
  the value of `used` would be greater than
  (total-reserved)*allocation_ration.
* a resource cannot be removed if used > 0.

aggregates and resources are loaded lazily

When a ResourceProvider is destroyed the inventories and
ResourceProviderAggregates associated with it are destroyed too
but only if there are no allocations (if used == 0).

A ResourceProviderList now exists with a single classmethod to
get_all(), which will construct ResourceProvider objects for all
ResourceProviders that are not compute nodes. This satisfies the
needs the resource pools api. The disjoint in name may need to
be resolved, if we care.

Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
Change-Id: I5b7dcee81bf37272a012fdfb0c5c8e8c2305045e

commit_message:
WIP Extend ResourceProvider to have resources and aggregates

There are pending discussion on how to make this work as
effectively as possible, so this is not a final design,
just a place to flesh out the ideas and explore where we've
had communication gaps.

A ResourceProvider now provides a facade over an Inventory, a
ResourceProviderAggregate and an Allocation. It is possible to
create a ResourceProvider, update its associated aggregates, and
inspect its associated inventories.

Associated aggregates are updated under the domain of the
object updating itself. Inventory is updated by independently
creating Inventory objects with the correctly associated resource
provider.

aggregates and resources are loaded lazily

When a ResourceProvider is destroyed the inventories and
ResourceProviderAggregates associated with it are destroyed too
but only if there are no allocations (if used == 0).

A ResourceProviderList now exists with a single classmethod to
get_all(), which will construct ResourceProvider objects for all
ResourceProviders that are not compute nodes. This satisfies the
needs of the resource pools api. The disjoint in name may need to
be resolved, if we care.

As most of the functionality involved here is driven by joins across
multiple tables the tests are hosted under the functional tree.

Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
Change-Id: I5b7dcee81bf37272a012fdfb0c5c8e8c2305045e

commit_message:
Return fixed_ips from port update

fixed_ips has a join relationship with port. During a DB transaction,
it will be acquired once. If the IPAllocation is updated after
acquiring fixed_ips, the port DB model object will still have the
stale value of fixed_ips, which is empty in the case of reported bug.

Expire the fixed_ips of the port can make the next query of port have
the latest fixed_ips, and thus, has the latest fixed_ips in the result
of update port.

Change-Id: I8ca52caf661daa2975cf53212d008eb953d83cc0
Closes-Bug: #1585738

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development Company, L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import netaddr import webob.exc from neutron.db import db_base_plugin_v2 from neutron.db import portbindings_db from neutron.extensions import portbindings from neutron.tests.unit.db import test_db_base_plugin_v2 class TestPlugin(db_base_plugin_v2.NeutronDbPluginV2, portbindings_db.PortBindingMixin): __native_pagination_support = True __native_sorting_support = True supported_extension_aliases = ["binding"] def get_plugin_description(self): return "Test Plugin" def get_plugin_type(self): return "test_plugin" def create_port(self, context, port): port_dict = super(TestPlugin, self).create_port(context, port) self._process_portbindings_create_and_update( context, port['port'], port_dict) return port_dict class TestPortUpdateIpam(test_db_base_plugin_v2.NeutronDbPluginV2TestCase): def setUp(self, plugin=None): if not plugin: plugin = 'neutron.tests.unit.ipam.test_port_update.TestPlugin' super(TestPortUpdateIpam, self).setUp(plugin=plugin) def test_port_update_allocate_from_net_subnet(self): """Tests that a port can be """ with self.network() as network: pass # Create a bound port with no IP address (since there is not subnet) response = self._create_port(self.fmt, net_id=network['network']['id'], tenant_id=network['network']['tenant_id'], arg_list=(portbindings.HOST_ID,), **{portbindings.HOST_ID: 'fakehost'}) port = self.deserialize(self.fmt, response) # Create the subnet and try to update the port to get an IP with self.subnet(network=network) as subnet: data = {'port': { 'fixed_ips': [{'subnet_id': subnet['subnet']['id']}]}} port_id = port['port']['id'] port_req = self.new_update_request('ports', data, port_id) response = port_req.get_response(self.api) res = self.deserialize(self.fmt, response) self.assertEqual(webob.exc.HTTPOk.code, response.status_int) self.assertEqual(1, len(res['port']['fixed_ips'])) ip = res['port']['fixed_ips'][0]['ip_address'] ip_net = netaddr.IPNetwork(subnet['subnet']['cidr']) self.assertIn(ip, ip_net) class TestPortUpdateIpamML2(TestPortUpdateIpam): def setUp(self): super(TestPortUpdateIpamML2, self).setUp( plugin='neutron.plugins.ml2.plugin.Ml2Plugin')

Replace '** **' with 'guilabel' to maintain consistency

There some use "guilabel", and another use '** **', this patch fix it,
and add a miss 'guilabel' markup.

commit_message:
[Tempest] HotFix for broken CI jobs

Recently merged commit to "neutron-fwaas" project [1] started using
one of Tempest's modules that appeared after version our plugin uses.
So, implement hotfix-workaround until we make all compatibility changes
to latest Tempest in our plugin.

For the moment, we cannot switch to latest Tempest as we already
have incompatibility for it, see bug [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/326150/
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1586129

Change-Id: I44655c83cc5588c5b94d0fad81162dd0c238b5b4
Closes-Bug: #1589964

commit_message:
Add a build for the gerrit its-storyboard plugin

The its-storyboard plugin will allows us to integrate gerrit with
storyboard.  Add a build for the gerrit its-storyboard plugin[1].
Building this plugin also requires building the its-base plugin[2]
because the its-storyboard depends on its-base.  Refactored the build
job to build a parent project if it's defined in the project yaml.

[1] https://gerrit.googlesource.com/plugins/its-storyboard
[2] https://gerrit.googlesource.com/plugins/its-base

Change-Id: I7b8461bb47ba902158531a64ddf88a9bb2b03312

commit_message:
Use apachectl graceful to restart apache

Sometimes apache fails to start after stop, due to unclosed
resources. apachectl is recomended way to restart apache
service [0] to avoid such problems.
This patch replace stop/start by apachectl graceful in
restart_apache_server function.

Reference:
[0] https://wiki.apache.org/httpd/CouldNotBindToAddress

Change-Id: I4934ca8d28c03feb7d2015935cd279cf3304f0da
Closes-Bug: #1590139
